text: Since the Paris Agreement of 2015 , in which signatories agreed to holding the increase in JJ - average NN to well below 2 °C above pre-industrial levels and to pursue efforts to limit the NN increase to 1.5 °C above pre-industrial levels , there have been JJ analyses that examined the implications of 1.5 °C and 2 °C of JJ NN , some of which are summarized in the IPCC Special Report on 1.5 °C ( IPCC SR1.5 ) 5 . JJ JJ methods6 and experiments have been VBN to better understand the differences between 1.5 °C and 2 °C of JJ NN above pre-industrial levels including timeslice extraction from coupled NN model ensembles 7,8 , use of single coupled model ensembles3,9 , multi- model atmosphere - only ensembles2 and pattern scaling 10,11 . It is not explicitly stated in the Paris Agreement text whether the NN levels refer to equilibrium or transient levels of JJ NN ; however , it is generally inferred that these targets refer to stabilized climate12 . Most of the analyses that were designed to understand the consequences of these JJ NN targets , especially those focused on atmospheric variables , VBN transient - model experiments ( analyses of NN - level rise13 and other oceanic variables often use longer coupled - model experiments ) . For example , timeslice extractions under high GHG NNS scenarios from the fifth phase of the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project experiment ( CMIP5 ) 1 sample a NN rapidly VBG through the Paris Agreement limits . Specially designed experiments , such as the Community NNP NNP Model ensemble3 , are run to emulate 1.5 °C and 2 °C warmer worlds with evolving radiative forcings for CD centuries to generate climates that are , in a globally averaged sense for NN air NN , in a quasi-equilibrium NN . The atmosphere - only simulations that form the 1.5 °C and 2 °C climates in the half a degree additional NN , prognosis and projected impacts2 ( HAPPI ) experiment are forced by NN recently observed NN NN NNS VBG transient CMIP5 simulations . These JJ experiments and methods each have differing degrees of transience and none of which are in full equilibrium . Although these experiments all have value , a robust comparison between transient and equilibrium climates has not been possible owing to fundamental differences in model design . Previous research comparing transient and equilibrium climates typically VBD single JJ NN models 14,15 or a JJ ensemble of models , such that agreement and consistency between models MD be investigated 16 . As a result , some differences between transient and equilibrium climates MD be inherent to the model , or models , that were VBN in these previous analyses . Furthermore , JJ transient simulations of a single model are needed to adequately sample across phases of internal variability to make a robust comparison . Here we demonstrate that transient and quasi-equilibrium climates can be compared VBG extended medium - NNS simulations and short - term high - NNS simulations from the CMIP5 multi-model ensemble1 . Our ‘ timeshift technique ’17 enabled us to analyse multiple models concurrently , such that JJ samples of model NNS were generated for both the transient and quasi-equilibrium NN NNS . We demonstrate that , for projections of mean and extreme NNS , the use of transient or quasi-equilibrium NN NNS has a substantial effect on the outcomes . We VBD the extended mid-range GHG NNS simulations to 2300 ( ECP4.5 ) from the CMIP5 ensemble1 ( Supplementary Table 1 ) to generate a quasi-equilibrium ensemble ( noting that the NN of the twenty - third century is not in full equilibrium ) that can be directly compared to transient NN through the equivalent model ’s level of JJ NN under a high - NNS scenario ( RCP 8.5 ) . The model - simulated JJ mean NN was subtracted from the distribution of JJ - average NNS of each model to generate ensembles for the comparison of transient and quasi-equilibrium NN NNS ( Fig. 1 ) ; regional average and extreme NNS were subsequently investigated . The robustness of this method — particularly the efficacy of comparing transient and quasi-equilibrium climates derived from a selection of models across JJ NN levels — and associated sensitivity tests are discussed in the Methods and the Supplementary NN . Specifically , we demonstrate that the difference between transient and quasi-equilibrium NN patterns shows little dependence on the level of JJ NN itself ( Supplementary NN ) , which differs by almost 2 °C across the models analysed here ( Supplementary Table 1 ) . We use this result to enable a comparison of the difference between transient and quasi-equilibrium climates with the 0.5 °C increment of NN between the Paris Agreement NN levels . From the ensembles of transient and equivalent quasi-equilibrium climates , we can infer differences between these NN NNS . For most land areas of the NN , the average boreal summer ( June–August ( JJA ) ) and winter ( December–February ( DJF ) ) NNS are substantially higher in the transient NN relative to the equivalent quasi-equilibrium NN with strong model agreement . This is especially JJ in boreal summer over continental NN zones in the Northern Hemisphere ( Fig. 2a , b ) . By contrast , over the Southern Ocean and the North Atlantic , there are JJ areas where a quasi-equilibrium NN is on average at least 0.5 °C warmer than the equivalent transient NN . In the quasi-equilibrium NN , the passage of NN has resulted in heat redistribution such that the land regions are cooler and the extratropical oceans are warmer 14,18 . This result aligns with previous research showing that ocean NN lags behind NN over the land surface19 . The quantification of these differences is important , especially given the recent focus on inferring differences in future warmer climates . As land regions are warmer in the transient NN NN , most NNS in the NN MD experience higher average local NNS than in a quasi-equilibrium NN . In boreal summer , 91 % of the NN ’s population20 ( 90 % confidence interval ( CI ) : 76–97 % ) MD experience warmer average NNS in the transient NN NN . JJ NNS in North NNP and Eurasia MD experience at least a 0.5 °C warmer local NN in a transient NN than in the quasi-equilibrium equivalent NN . In boreal winter , 85 % of the JJ population ( 90 % CI : 70 –92 % ) are in locations where the transient NN is warmer than the quasi-equilibrium NN . In total , more than 600 CD NNS in boreal summer and more than 200 CD in boreal winter live in locations where a rapidly VBG NN is at least 0.5 °C warmer than the equivalent equilibrium NN . By contrast , fewer than 20 CD NNS live in locations where an equilibrium NN is on average more than 0.5 °C warmer than the transient equivalent for either boreal summer or winter . The difference between transient and quasi-equilibrium NN NNS is substantial relative to the difference between the projected 1.5 °C and 2 °C warmer worlds 8,11 ( Fig. 3 ) . Over the Southern Ocean and North Atlantic , where the regional projected NN from 1.5 °C to 2 °C of JJ NN is lower than elsewhere , the difference between transient and quasi-equilibrium climates exceeds the difference in regional NNS between the Paris Agreement levels . Both of these regions play major roles in the uptake and transport of NN and heat21 , as they warm at much slower rates compared with other parts of the NN . Overall , RB 15 % of NNP ’s NN area has a bigger difference between the transient and quasi-equilibrium climates than between the Paris Agreement NN levels . This includes both slow - NN ocean areas , where the quasi-equilibrium 1.5 °C NN is warmer than a transient 2 °C NN , and continental land regions , where the transient 1.5 °C NN is warmer than a quasi-equilibrium 2 °C NN . For a typical location on NNP ’s NN , the absolute difference between transient and quasi-equilibrium climates is RB 40 % of the absolute difference between the Paris NN limits . The difference between transient and equilibrium climates extends to NN extremes . The probability ratio of moderate heat extremes 22 , such as CD - in - ten hot seasons ( Fig. 4a , b ) , shows broad regions where a heat event is twice as likely in the transient NN ( that is , a CD - in - five NN event instead ) compared with a quasi-equilibrium NN NN . This is particularly JJ in boreal summer where , for almost all land regions of the NN , the likelihood of a hot season is significantly higher in a transient NN compared with the equivalent quasi-equilibrium NN . Regions with at least a doubling in the probability of hot summers in a transient NN compared with a quasi-equilibrium NN of equivalent JJ NN encompass major cities including NNP NNP City , Istanbul , Baghdad , Seoul and Tokyo . Although this is a JJ - scale analysis , PRP MD infer that for these densely populated locations , the heat - related impacts of JJ - induced NN NN MD be lessened in a stabilized NN compared with a rapidly VBG NN at the same level of JJ NN . A similar pattern of results was VBN when examining cold extremes , with far fewer cold seasons ( below the 10th percentile extracted from the quasi- equilibrium NN ) in the transient NN NN in Northern Hemisphere land areas ( Supplementary Fig. 5 ) . Overlaying estimates of gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita20 show that poorer areas of the NN tend to experience greater probability of hot seasons in a transient NN than a quasi-equilibrium equivalent ( in DJF the correlation is − 0.39 , although in JJA it is negligible ) . There is a JJ benefit of NN stabilization in terms of reduced frequency of hot extremes relative to a rapidly VBG NN at the same JJ NN level , and this is particularly JJ for the developing NN , in which the likelihood of hot seasons is reduced NN - round . JJ analyses written for the IPCC SR1.5 have focused on understanding NNS in hot and cold extremes between the Paris Agreement JJ NN limits 8,23 , 24 . The results presented in this NN demonstrate that the difference in the frequency of hot and cold extremes between a transient and quasi-equilibrium NN NN at a given level of JJ NN is RB JJ for JJ populated regions of the NN . The frequency of hot summers in a NN where JJ - average NN rapidly passes through a JJ NN level relative to equilibrating at that level is substantially greater in the Middle East , much of Eurasia and northern Africa , and North NNP . Results from some studies of future extremes , such as ref. 23 , MD apply to transient 1.5 °C and 2 °C warmer worlds , but MD probably represent substantial overestimates for NNS in the frequency of heat extremes for equilibrium 1.5 °C and 2 °C climates relative to the present . The comparison of RCP 8.5 and ECP4.5 simulations from a multi- model ensemble enabled us to isolate the effects of the transient and quasi-equilibrium nature of the JJ model experiments . This enabled us to address a fundamental question about the nature of the NNP ’s NN NN : what differences in NN MD we expect between transient and equilibrium warmer worlds for a given level of JJ NN ? This is a vitally important question in the context of international agreements such as the Paris Agreement , for which analyses VBG transient and equilibrium NN model experiments MD yield JJ results and lead to the formation of JJ conclusions and policy pathways . It is worth noting that some of the largest differences between transient and quasi-equilibrium NN NNS are identified for regions that are poorly observed and where model biases exist , such as the Southern Ocean25 . As a result , projections for the Southern Ocean should be treated with caution , although they generally align with our understanding of the NN system19 . Further discussion of the results for the Southern Ocean is provided in the Supplementary NN . The differences between transient and equilibrium NN NNS have important implications in impact modelling . For example , some empirical impact models , such as damage functions 26 , are VBN on JJ - average NN , but in reality PRP MD expect JJ JJ costs to occur between transient and equilibrium warmer worlds for both the globe as a whole26 and individual NNS 27 , especially developing NNS in the tropics , due to the JJ patterns of regional NN . Differences in methods VBN to simulate future climates and their impacts have the potential to lead to decision - makers receiving inadequate NN about the nature of possible future climates for their region of interest . This MD result in the development of ineffective policy , especially in building resilience for future extreme heat events , which is already more challenging in the developing world28 . JJ of our results suggest that the differences between transient and quasi-equilibrium climates are substantial . A future 1.5 °C or 2 °C quasi-equilibrium warmer NN reached after an overshoot ( that is , in NNS in which JJ NN has exceeded these limits but then fallen ) MD probably look very JJ to the equivalent transient 1.5 °C or 2 °C NN that the NN is likely to experience in the coming decades 29,30 . Indeed , a transient warmer NN represents a poor predictor for an equivalent equilibrium NN in JJ populated land regions where the difference in average seasonal NNS is at least 0.5 °C and the likelihood of hot extremes is at least twice as high in some places under the transient NN . Studies of the implications of future JJ NN must therefore be very clear in their framing of results with respect to the transience of the experiments VBN for their conclusions to be relevant for policy development . Current multi-model projection efforts , such as CMIP5 ( ref. 1 ) and the subsequent CMIP6 ( ref. 4 ) projects , do not incorporate experiments that explicitly address the needs of policy - makers following the Paris Agreement . Multi - model experiments that can be VBN to examine NN NN at stabilized 1.5 °C and 2 °C warmer climates MD be invaluable in meeting the needs of decision - makers given that the Paris Agreement is implicitly targeting stabilized JJ NN levels12 and that we have demonstrated here that the rate of JJ NN has a JJ effect on the NN pattern across the globe . Although single - model experiments have been performed previously3 , these are not a substitute for multi- model projections that can more comprehensively examine the impacts of the Paris Agreement JJ NN levels . Our NN highlights the notable differences in model - simulated transient and quasi-equilibrium NN NNS . We find that these differences are significant and substantial across JJ regions of the NN , such that they must be considered in the design of both model studies on the implications of future JJ NN , and in the design of future multi- model experiments following CMIP5 and CMIP6 . Studies must be clear in the precise definition of NN targets and the framework given the differing implications of a given level of JJ NN depending on the transience of the NN NN .

text: Back in 1989 , Californians received a sobering warning : The accumulation of heat - trapping gases in the atmosphere MD likely bring more droughts , floods , fires , and heat waves to the NN . In the thirty NNS since , those projections of what MD happen in a VBG NN have proven to be remarkably prescient . “ We ’ve already observed some of the things we expected in 1989 , ” VBD Susan Fischer Wilhelm , a research manager at the California NNP Commission , the agency that compiled the report . The assessment laid the groundwork for what has arguably become the country ’s most ambitious effort to address JJ NN . But to JJ who worked on the report , looking back on it now only underscores how RB we ’ve waited to act — and how much NN has been wasted . “ I felt a sense of pride of being able to participate in something IN this , but RB a sense of regret for us as a society , ” VBD Les Baxter , who worked on the report as a policy analyst at the CEC and is now vice NN of program strategy for the Pew Charitable Trusts . “ We ’ve VBN what we VBP to do and we just keep refusing to do it . ” The report might have remained lost to history if Gary Estes had n’t been VBG through boxes in his garage last NN and stumbled upon a copy . For decades , Estes has organized the annual California Extreme Precipitation Symposium . And he decided to use this NN ’s meeting as an opportunity to look back at the 185 - page report . “ I thought it MD be an appropriate thing to do 30 NNS later , ” VBD Estes , a citizen activist and self - described “ NN nut . ” The symposium , held this week at UC Davis , brought together NN and NN NNS to discuss report ’s findings . Its NN - specific projections were drawn from scientific studies and assessments by the U.S. NNP Protection Agency that were released in the late 1980s , as well as from detailed analyses conducted by NN agencies . “ I was impressed with the level of rigor that they were able to bring , ” VBD Wilhelm , who gave a presentation at the symposium outlining what we knew then and what we VBP now . The report explained that doubling the concentration of NN dioxide in the atmosphere MD raise NNS in California by roughly 3 degrees Celsius — which will happen by mid-century if NNS continue to rise , according to the most recent California NNP NNP Assessment . Then , as now , NN models showed no clear NN in the NN ’s average annual precipitation . But the authors noted that 3 degrees of NN MD reduce the area of mountain snow cover by half . And it MD increase the frequency and severity of winter floods , as more NN fell as rain instead of snow . ( Both NNS have already started to occur , Wilhelm VBD . ) In contrast , spring runoff MD drop by a third . ( They ’ve already fallen over the last century , Wilhelm VBD . ) The authors added that , although there was still debate among NNS at the NN , NN NN MD RB bring more variable NN . The report outlined the ways in which NNS in the seasonal pattern of precipitation MD pose problems for the NN ’s reservoirs , which MD have to release NN during the rainy season to avoid overflowing . ( That ’s exactly what happened in the the 2017 Oroville Dam NN . ) In the summer , NN shortages MD impact ecosystems , farmers and hydropower production , the authors wrote . Heat and drought MD stress forests , which MD likely “ experience lower growth and higher susceptibility to fires , insects , and NN . ” ( This , too , has come to pass . ) The report RB warned that NN NN MD raise NN level , increase electricity demand , worsen air quality , increase heat - related deaths and be a drain on the NN ’s economy . “ It strikes me that we were RB on , ” VBD Kari Smith , now a division manager at the San Jose Clean NNP department who helped oversee the report when she worked at the CEC . “ I do n’t VB there was anything that we VBD that is radically off - base . ” If anything , she VBD , the report underestimated the degree to which NN impacts are interrelated . For instance , in 1989 , few foresaw that wildfire NN MD VB utilities to consider cutting NN to thousands of residents , jeopardizing the reliability of electricity . The report came about after the legislature asked the CEC to assess “ the effect of JJ NN trends on California ’s NN , economy , environment , agriculture , and NN . ” Soon after , the CEC released the NN ’s JJ inventory of NN gas NNS in 1990 and a set of NN policy recommendations in 1991 . AB 4420 , the 1988 NN that mandated the reports , was introduced by Byron Sher , a Stanford law professor and NN politician best VBN for authoring California ’s clean air and safe drinking NN acts . JJ NN had just begun to seep into the JJ consciousness . Alarmed by signs of JJ NN and the results of early NN models , NNS were VBG JJ with their concerns about what JJ then called the “ NN effect . ” Sher immediately saw the threat to California . “ The heat is on , ” he VBD the Sacramento Bee in 1989 . “ The NN can either ignore what NN is telling us or we can respond to this challenge in a responsible NN . ” Sher ’s NN was part of a flurry of bipartisan JJ activity on NN NN across the country . In his 1988 presidential campaign , George H.W. Bush vowed to combat the NN effect with “ the White NNP effect . ” In Congress , Democrats and Republicans introduced more than a dozen bills to curb atmospheric pollution . Several called for reducing NN gas NNS to 20 % below 1988 levels by the NN 2000 . ( IN the same NN , the NN agreed to phase out ozone - destroying substances under an agreement that NNP Reagan helped negotiate . ) By comparison , AB 4420 was relatively modest , VBD Kip Lipper , who was Sher ’s chief of staff and helped draft the NN . But AB 4420 had the distinction of actually passing . ( The assembly voted 58 to 13 in favor of the NN ; the senate voted 38-0 . “ It ’s the JJ law enacted anywhere in the NNP NNPS that VBD the term ‘ JJ NN , ’ ” VBD Lipper , who still serves as the chief policy advisor for NN and environment to the NN pro tem of the NN senate . Lipper VBD the report did n’t make a JJ splash . But it did provide a basis for everything that came later , including the NN ’s renewable NN portfolio standard and its cap - and - trade program . “ We tried to seed the ground , if you will , by saying , ‘ Let ’s just VB a report . Let ’s have this task force look at this , ” he VBD . It MD be 12 NNS before the next piece of NN legislation passed . And AB 32 — which set the NN ’s JJ NNS reduction target — did n’t become law until 2006 . The reasons for the slow response are familiar : the daunting scope of NN NN , the challenges of transitioning away from fossil fuels , and tenacious opposition by industry . But JJ VBP there was RB uncertainty about the reality of NN NN in the 1980s . While the report VBD that JJ NN posed a significant NN to California , it RB acknowledged that the matter was n’t entirely settled . In fact , the authors devoted six pages to “ Challenges to the NNP NNP Concept . ” Baxter felt that the NN was solid , but that there was n’t enough NN that it was happening yet . “ I remember thinking to myself , ‘ Well , we ’ll VB enough in 20 or 25 NNS , ’ ” he VBD . Such reservations made it hard for politicians to push for NN , RB if they cared deeply about JJ NN , Smith VBD . “ It was difficult to lead with NN NN for a JJ NN because it was considered maybe a little radical . ” Instead , leaders looked for ways to VB at NN mitigation by focusing on other objectives , IN improving air quality and NN efficiency . That was a start , but not enough to tackle the problem , she VBD . Today , NNS have no doubts about NN NN and Californians VBP the impacts all IN them . “ We now have observed NNS — not projections , nothing speculative — to show NN - related trends that are already affecting the NN in ways that were anticipated 30 NNS ago , ” Wilhelm VBD . Indeed , if the report ’s authors erred in any NN , it was that they did n’t anticipate just how fast these NNS MD occur . “ They thought that we had at least 100 NNS before it became existential , ” Smith VBD . “ Now , 30 NNS later , we ’re recognizing that it all happened a lot more quickly than we anticipated . ”

text: To avoid dangerous NN NN , the 195 NNS that signed the Paris Agreement of 2015 agreed ‘ to keep the increase in JJ mean NN NN to well below 2° C , and to limit the increase to 1.5° C , since this MD significantly reduce the risks and impacts of NN NN ’ . In the shorter term , the EU has set a target to reduce NN gas NNS levels by at least 40 % below 1990 levels by 2030 . NN gases are emitted through both natural processes and JJ activities . text: The NNP Nations ’ Environment Program released a rather dire report Wednesday concluding that by 2030 , JJ production of fossil fuels — extracted coal , oil and natural gas — MD be more than double what we can safely consume if we hope to limit the most severe impacts from JJ - caused JJ NN . In other words , rather than adopting policies and practices to slow the rise in JJ NNS , humanity is essentially continuing on the same suicidal course it ’s been on for decades . And , of course , NNP administration policies seeking ever more fossil fuel production in the U.S. are exactly opposite of what we VBP to do . The NNS Gap Report is the JJ U.N. effort to compare projected JJ NNS with the stated goals of the 2015 Paris agreement , in which NN governments acknowledged the looming danger and pledged to take steps to limit NNS of NN gases . The agreement , which aimed to limit the rise in JJ NNS to 1.5 degrees Celsius above preindustrial levels , was shepherded by the Obama administration ; NNP NNP ’s decision to withdraw from the pact MD leave the U.S. , despite its key role in forging the agreement , as a JJ outlier , the sole country not a party to it . The JJ report extrapolates from NNS NNS from the U.S. and seven other nations that account for 60 % of JJ fossil fuel production . It RB builds on an earlier report that projects that RB if nations meet their current commitments under the Paris agreement NNS MD still rise somewhere between 3 and 4 degrees Celsius . RB more troublesome : JJ NN NNS “ have remained exactly at the levels projected a decade ago , under the business - as - usual scenarios VBN in NNS Gap Reports , ” wrote Inger Andersen , executive director of the Environment Program . That spotlights a key hurdle in making meaningful NNS in how we create and consume NN . Too JJ nations pursue too JJ policies — from pushing increased fossil fuel production to subsidies for coal , oil and gas industries — that work against their promised reductions in NNS . There is no easy NN to fix this , but there are some pretty clear steps that MD be taken , including dropping tax breaks and subsidies for the fuels that are imperiling us , thus letting NN prices more accurately reflect the JJ cost ; changing the NN itself by VBG NN policies , including NN taxes , to push a rapid JJ transition to renewable NN ; and helping developing nations whose demands for NN are growing to build renewable NN infrastructures that do not rely on fossil fuels . And we must do this with a sense of urgency , and without deluding ourselves about the fate that awaits us if we do not .

text: It 's become as much a winter tradition as eggnog at Christmas and champagne on NNP NNP 's Eve  the JJ major snowstorm of the NN bringing out the NN - VB skeptics . And the bona fide blizzard that has frozen much of the Northeast just a few days after winter officially began definitely qualifies as major . But while piles of snow blocking your driveway hardly conjure images of a dangerously VBG NN , it does n't mean that NN NN is a myth . The NNP Meteorological Organization recently reported that 2010 is almost certainly VBG to be CD of the three warmest NNS on record , while 2001 to 2010 is already the hottest decade in recorded history . Indeed , according to some NNS , all of these events MD actually be connected . CD NN is that a warmer Arctic MD actually lead to colder and snowier winters in the northern mid-latitudes . RB as NNS IN Britain  suffering through the coldest December on record  deal with low NNS and unusual snow , the Arctic has kept on NN , with Greenland and Arctic Canada experiencing the hottest NN on record . NNS in that region have been 5.4 °F to 7.2 °F ( 3 °C to 4 °C ) above normal in 2010 . As a result , the Arctic sea-ice cover has continued to shrink ; this September , the minimum summer sea-ice extent was more than 770,000 sq. mi. ( 2 CD sq km ) below the JJ - term average , and the third - smallest on record . Snow MD be piling up in midtown Manhattan , but the Arctic is continuing its JJ - term meltdown . The loss of Arctic NN NN helps accelerate the NN of the atmosphere in the far north , thanks to what 's VBN as the albedo effect . White NN reflects sunlight into NN , cooling the air , but when NN melts and is replaced with dark ocean NN , the effect is reversed and more of the NN 's heat is absorbed . As the Arctic air warms , it raises the altitude of discrete areas of high pressure , which can then alter wind patterns . This , in turn , can weaken the jet stream , allowing more cold air to seep out of the Arctic and into Europe and the eastern U.S. As the authors of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration 's recent " Arctic Report Card " put it , " There is NN that the effect of higher air NNS in the lower Arctic atmosphere in fall is contributing to NNS in the atmospheric circulation in both the Arctic and northern mid-latitudes . Winter 2009 - 2010 showed a JJ connectivity between mid-latitude extreme cold and snowy NN events and NNS in the wind patterns of the Arctic ; the so - called Warm Arctic Cold Continents pattern . " The NN seems counterintuitive , but as Jeff Masters , a meteorologist who writes the great Wunder Blog at NNP Underground , put it in a recent post , it makes sense : " This pattern is kind of IN leaving the refrigerator door ajar  the refrigerator warms up , but all the cold air spills out into the NN . " The NN overall is still VBG  and the Arctic fastest of all  but the cold air from the far north can result in biting winter NN and major storms , for a while at least . That 's not the only NN . Judah Cohen , the director of seasonal forecasting at the JJ research firm AER , has written that increasing seasonal snow cover in Siberia MD drive extreme winter NN . RB as the NN has continued to warm and the Arctic has melted , seasonal snow cover has increased in Siberia , especially north of high Asian mountain ranges IN the Himalayas . ( As the NN warms overall , the atmosphere can hold more moisture , which can lead to more precipitation  falling as snow in places IN Siberia that remain relatively cold . ) All that Siberian snow creates a dome of cold air near the mountains , which bends the passing jet stream . Instead of flowing west to east , the jet stream moves in a more north to south fashion , carrying cold air south from the Arctic in the eastern U.S. and in Europe . Cohen 's NN is n't accepted by all NN and NN NNS , but the National NNP Foundation has VBN that in past NNS his model has predicted winter NN more accurately than traditional forecasts . Of course , it 's important to remember that NN is n't the same as NN  a single storm , or RB a single cold winter , can tell us little about the overall NN . Anomalies do happen , and sometimes they dump 20 inches ( 50 cm ) of snow on Central Park . The systems that govern NN on this NN are incredibly complex , and our ability to understand why individual events occur  and to forecast them for the future  is still imperfect . That more than anything is what drives  and distorts  so much of the stubborn debate over NN NN . Just because NN models predict that the NN will continue to heat up in the future as we continue to pour NN - gas NNS into the atmosphere does n't mean that NN will be a steady , RB process . Far from it  and as parts of the NN warm far faster than others , extreme events , including winter ones , MD become more common . JJ Yorkers cursing NNP Gore as they dig out their cars should recall this past July  the second hottest month on record in the city . text: Scotland is already experiencing the effects of NN NN , and this brings both risks and opportunities . NN projections for the next century indicate that NN trends observed over the last century will not only continue , but are likely to intensify . Adapting to NN NN will be necessary regardless of how much we manage to cut our NNS , as historic NNS have already changed our NN and will continue to do so in decades to come . The NNP NNP ( Scotland ) Act 2009 placed a duty on ministers to lay a programme for NN NN NN before the Scottish Parliament as soon as reasonably practicable after the UK NNP NNP NNP Assessment ( UKCCRA ) , the latest of which includes a summary report for Scotland . The Act RB requires an annual report on progress and for the advisory body , the Committee for NNP NNP NNP Sub Committee ( ASC ) , to prepare a report within CD NNS , setting out its independent assessment of the progress made on objectives , proposals and policies set out in the programme . The second Scottish NNP NNP NNP Programme ( SCCAP ) to VB prepare for the impact of NN NN was launched in September 2019 . It addresses the risks set out in the UK NNP NNP NNP Assessment ( UK CCRA ) 2017 , published under section 56 of the UK NNP NNP Act 2008 . The programme has been aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Goals to ensure it complements our international ambitions . Its launch coincided with a NNP Nations NNP NNP summit in NNP NNP . The JJ SCCAP was launched in NNP 2014 , with the aim of increasing the resilience of Scotland 's NNS , environment and economy to the impacts of a changing NN . The ASC 's JJ independent assessment of the JJ SCCAP recognised the SCCAP as a positive start in taking steps to prepare for NN NN . The final assessment of the JJ SCCAP was published in March 2019 and VBD that there had been notable progress since the JJ assessment , but there was still some continuing concern and gaps remaining in key NN and NNS , which it expected to be considered in the second SCCAP . We have published annual progress reports since 2015 . The JJ annual progress report on the second SCCAP was published in NNP 2020 and can be viewed below : The annual progress reports on the JJ SCCAP can be accessed as follows : We fund NNP Scotland to provide advice and support to VB organisations , businesses and communities adapt to the impacts of NN NN . text: Let ’s be honest : “ Last NN was CD of the hottest NNS ever recorded ” has become a common story . It ’s NN in the same NN the most popular boys ’ baby names are NN . Since Donald NNP rode down his gilded escalator and announced he was running for NN , the NN has experienced its hottest recorded version of each individual month , according to NOAA . So it ’s worth VBG back in history to VB just how outlandish our current situation is . The median NNP is a little more than 38 NNS old . The NN before she was born was 1980 . It was , at the NN , the hottest NN ever measured . A July heat wave that NN killed 1,265 Americans and caused more than $ 20 CD in damage nationwide . In an op - ed that summer , a weatherman in Westchester , NNP NNP , expressed so much regret about giving in and buying a car with an air conditioner that he wondered whether Americans of his demographic were “ less tolerant of extreme heat than our NNS and grandparents . ” His NNS ’ generation made do without air - conditioned cars , he figured , and his grandparents did n’t RB have electric ceiling fans . text: Despite the Internet , connectivity , and linking technologies , distance has not shrunk the Australian sense of self , an often provincial appraisal of the NN seen in slow motion and stills . Whether it ’s the “ flower revolution ” or Michel Foucault , trends and ideas are often delayed , and seem almost cutely anachronistic by the NN they make landfall down under . Wedded to the insatiable urge to reap , rent and remove from the NN , and you have the ultimate myopic : Australia , the exceptional country , outside the stream of history and , dare it be VBN , the inconveniences of NN . With some 11,000 NNS warning that NN NNP “ clearly and unequivocally faces a NN emergency ” , some sense of it was registered on the Australian JJ scene , if only barely . The “ NNP NNPS ’ Warning of a NN Emergency ” published in BioScience does not shy away from the language of catastrophe and emergency . “ Despite 40 NNS of JJ NN negotiations … we have generally conducted business as usual and have largely failed to address this predicament . ” NN NN had not merely arrived but bulldozed itself into recognition , “ accelerating faster than JJ NNS expected . ” The authors and signatories suggest that , “ An immense increase of scale in endeavours to conserve our biosphere is needed to avoid untold suffering due to the NN NN . ” JJ debates on the subject of NN NN had mostly focused on JJ NN NN , a clearly inadequate approach that avoids “ the breath of JJ activities and the real dangers stemming from a VBG NN . ” Areas of urgent redress were RB suggested . NN efficiency and a reduction in the use of fossil fuels are high on the list . “ We VBP a NN - free economy that explicitly addresses JJ dependence on the biosphere and policies that guide JJ decisions accordingly . ” The call for a NN of language is encouraged : rhetoric of GDP growth and affluence needs to be replaced by sustainability “ and improving JJ well - being by prioritizing basic needs and reducing inequality . ” Not exactly music for the muscular fossil fuel lobby . Another song sheet that MD not have impressed the fossil fuel industries was an event that barely disturbed the press releases . This month , the National Electricity NNP in Australia received a contribution from wind , solar and hydro NN amounting to half of the total NN production . Rooftop solar contributions came in at 23.7 percent , with wind ( 15.7 percent ) , JJ - scale solar ( 8.8 percent ) and hydro ( 1.9 percent ) bringing up the rear . With the release of the report , Australia braced itself for the incinerating fury of bush fires that have arrived earlier this season . The NN of NNP South Wales is anticipating what the Rural Fire Services Commissioner Shane Fitzsimmons describes as “ the most dangerous bushfire week this nation has ever seen ” . The warnings were already pressing through the policy pipeline in the last decade . The National Inquiry on Bushfire Mitigation and Management ’s 2004 report to the Council of Australian NNP warned that , “ Fires ’ frequency , intensity and size are expected to increase under NN NN as NNS rise , rainfall variability increases , droughts become more severe and ecosystem dynamics alter , resulting in changed biomass fuel loads and types . ” The authors of the report VBP on to suggest that “ projected hotter , drier and windier conditions associated with NN NN caused by NN NN MD extend the period of fuel drying and increase rates of fire spread . ” Earlier this NN , JJ NSW Fires Chief Greg Mullins and 22 other emergency honchos warned Prime Minister Morrison of the dangers that MD face Australia this summer , suggesting that the NN meet to discuss some form of NN against risks of conflagration . The meeting has yet to take place , leaving such politicians as Adam Bandt , the Greens MP for Melbourne , certain that Morrison “ bears some responsibility and must apologise to the communities impacted ” . Various Australian politicians , as then , were having none of it . Charged with the task of keeping a plunderer ’s lifestyle in perpetuity , the well - fed pigs in clover , the following words of the BioScience report sit uncomfortably with members of the Morrison NN . “ The NN NN is closely linked to excessive consumption of the wealthy lifestyle . The most affluent NNS are mainly responsible for the historical GHG NNS and generally have the greatest per capita NNS . ” The Deputy Prime Minister Michael McCormack preferred some tea and sympathy in responding to the victims of the fires , not policy and prognosis . “ They do n’t VB the ravings of some pure enlightened and woke capital city greenies at this NN when they are trying to save their homes . ” McCormack ’s primary target was the Green party itself , which he accused of fiddling politically while Australia burned . “ That ’s what Adam Bandt , and the Greens , and Richard Di Natale , and all those other inner-city raving lunatics – and quite frankly , that ’s how he was carrying on yesterday – that ’s what they VBP , we ’re not VBG to VB down that path . ” Other politicians have adopted a similar approach : the now is what matters , and never VBP previous failings and future disasters . NSW Premier Gladys Berejikilian provided the stellar example . “ For any of us on the ground , speaking to NNS traumatised , speaking to NNS fighting fires for weeks … VB exactly what the priorities should be , and that is saving NN and property ” . NN NN , in other words , was something for another day , another slot in the packed meeting schedule . Morrison reiterated the position . He was “ focused on the needs of the NNS ” . He spoke of having “ firefighters out there saving someone else ’s NN while their own NN is burning down , and when we are in that sort of situation , that is where attention must be . ” Mayors from the areas most affected by the recent conflagration have been crankily unimpressed by the platitudes . NN NN literature , they surmise , is being assiduously avoided by the NN . The unfortunately named Carol Sparks , Mayor of Glen Innes , site of CD deaths over the weekend , suggested that McCormack needed “ to read the NN , and that is what I am VBG by , is the NN . ” Forget , suggested the mayor , the politics here . NN had imposed its cold , objective hand on the matter . Mid Coast Mayor Claire Pontin was similarly riled , notably by suggestions that fires were the staple of Australian NN and landscape . “ We ’ve not had situations IN that . Fifty NNS ago , this MD never happen . ” There are few incentives for humanity to adapt than through the infliction of catastrophic conditions . Pandemics , NN wars and existential NN have done their bit in propelling NN . But luxury produces complacency ; well fed bellies induce sloth . Come the writing of humanity ’s extensive biography of preying on the NN , Australia and its JJ classes will have much to answer for . text: THE NN MD have already crossed nine key " tipping points " that will lead to catastrophic NN NN , NNS warn . Passing the alarming milestones means " we are in a NN of planetary emergency " that MD VB humanity wiped from the NN . So much damage has been done in the nine outlined areas that the effects of JJ NN MD accelerate and create a deadly domino effect , researchers wrote in the journal Nature . Points of no return picked out by the team include the loss of the Amazon rainforest and the great NN sheets of Antarctica and Greenland – damage from which our NN MD never recover . " A decade ago we identified a suite of potential tipping points in the NNP NN , " VBD lead author Professor Tim Lenton , from the NNP of Exeter . " Now we VBP NN that over half of them have been activated . " The team , made up of top researchers from the UK , Germany , Denmark and Australia , VBD urgent NN was needed to reduce NNS before further milestones are passed . " The growing threat of rapid , irreversible NNS means it is no longer responsible to wait and VB , " Professor Lenton VBD . " The situation is urgent and we VBP an emergency response . " A tipping point is reached when certain impacts of JJ NN become unstoppable , such as heavy NN loss in Antarctica . Among the nine tipping points outlined by NNS were thawing of permafrost in NNP , JJ - scale die - offs of coral and a slowdown of ocean currents in the Atlantic . Droughts in the Amazon rainforest and fires in the far north of Canada and NNP were RB VBN to be key crossroads identified a decade ago that are now " active " . Due to the NN our NN 's ecosystem is connected , as each tipping point is reached , others not currently active are pushed closer to the brink . " It is not only JJ pressures on NNP that continue rising to unprecedented levels , " VBD NN coauthor Professor Johan Rockström , of the Potsdam Institute in Germany . " As NN advances , we must admit that we have underestimated the risks of unleashing irreversible NNS , where the NN self - amplifies JJ NN . " This cascade of NNS sparked by JJ NN MD threaten the existence of JJ civilisations , according to the researchers . The collapse of major NN sheets on Greenland and Antarctica alone MD drive NN levels up by CD metres , turfing millions in coastal areas from their homes . NNS to Atlantic currents have already triggered more frequent and destructive hurricanes across the western NN . In the past , it was thought that the NN MD VB to heat up by 5C for NNP 's tipping points to be reached . However , NN shows we have already started to hit them between 1C and 2C . NNP has heated by RB 1C since pre-industrial NNS , a figure that is certain to rise in the coming decades . " Scientifically , this provides strong NN for declaring a NN of planetary emergency , " Professor Rockström added . " We must unleash NN NN that accelerates the path towards a NN that can continue evolving on a stable NN . " Nearly 200 NNS signed the 2015 Paris Agreement , pledging to keep JJ NN below 2C . However , current national NNS pledges – RB if they are met – MD lead to 3C of NN . Experts argued that further international NN was needed , as it MD slow the impacts of NN NN , giving more NN for NNS to adapt . Professor Lenton added : " We might already have crossed the threshold for a cascade of inter-related tipping points . " However , the rate at which they progress , and therefore the NN they pose , can be reduced by cutting our NNS . " His team concluded in their paper : " If damaging tipping cascades can occur and a JJ tipping cannot be ruled out , then this is an existential threat to civilisation . " " A saving grace is that the rate at which damage accumulates from tipping MD still be under our NN to some extent . " The stability and resilience of our NN is in peril . International NN – not just words – must reflect this . " In other NN , shocking photos this week revealed how Swiss glaciers have nearly disappeared since the 1800s . text: NN NN is the biggest challenge facing humanity today . The associated JJ NN and humidification , increases in the severity and frequency of extreme NN events , extension of the ranges of vector ‐borne diseases , and the consequent JJ and JJ stresses and disruption will have major negative consequences on JJ aspects of NN care . NNS whose resilience to NN is already impaired MD suffer disproportionately from these JJ NNS , which are of unprecedented reach and magnitude . There has been little connection made so far between NN NN and epilepsy . We briefly review the history of NN NN NN and the subsequent response of the JJ scientific community . We consider how NN NN effects might in general affect NN and NN . We consider some of the underlying complex interactions that , for example , favor the spread of vector ‐borne diseases and how NN models operate and MD VB plan for JJ and local NNS . We then speculate specifically on how these generic ideas MD apply specifically to epilepsy . We consider these impacts at levels from molecular to the epidemiological . NNS are sparse , and there is undoubtedly a NN for more NN to enable better estimation of possible effects of NN NN on care in epilepsy . We RB consider how the professional activities of those involved in epilepsy NN care might contribute to JJ NN NNS , for example , through flying for conference attendance . Healthcare organizations across the NN are already considering , and responding to , JJ of these issues . We argue for more research in this area , but RB for NN today . Actions today are likely to generate cobenefits for NN care , including care in epilepsy , resulting from efforts to decarbonize , mitigate effects of NN NN that has already happened , and plan for NN to NN NN . NN NN , dominated by NN NN , is accepted by the majority of informed authorities as a clear feature of the Anthropocene era , and is becoming the lived experience shared by JJ of us globally , as we comment with increasing frequency about the unseasonal NN and the environment transforming IN us . The effects of NN NN will be pervasive , with no sphere of JJ endeavor likely to be untouched . As the 5th assessment report from the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) VBZ : “ Continued emission of NN gases will VB further NN and JJ ‐lasting NNS in all components of the NN NN , increasing the likelihood of severe , pervasive and irreversible impacts for NNS and ecosystems . Limiting NN NN MD require substantial and sustained reductions in NN gas NNS which , together with NN , can limit NN NN risks . ” 1 The risks to JJ NN posed by NN NN have already received extensive attention . The fourth edition , published in 2018 , of the Lancet Countdown on NN and NN NN stated NN NN was “ the biggest JJ NN threat of the 21st century , ” warning that failure to take NN MD lead to disasters that “ disrupt core JJ NN infrastructure and overwhelm NN services . ” 2 A further Lancet commission report details the interaction between significant healthcare challenges ( a “ syndemic ” ) , working as multipliers that exacerbate unitary JJ challenges , such as obesity , undernutrition , and NN NN . 3 Several authorities and organizations have launched programs IN the effects of NN NN . The NNP NNP and NNP Alliance , formed in 2011 , “ works to tackle NN NN and to protect and promote JJ NN ” and provides useful links and resources ( http://climateandhealthalliance.org/). Several international groups , nations , and regions have their own healthcare initiatives focused on NN NN , such as the NNP Society Consortium on NNP and NNP in the NNP NNPS ( https://medsocietiesforclimatehealth.org/), the UK NNP Alliance on NNP NNP ( http://www.ukhealthalliance.org/), Doctors for the Environment Australia ( https://www.dea.org.au/), the Regional Institute of NNP Medicine and Research ( Rajasthan , India ) ( http://www.rihmr.org/), the European Environment and NNP Youth Coalition ( http://www.eehyc.org/), and the UK NHS ( https://www.sduhealth.org.uk/policy-strategy/reporting/nhs-carbon-footprint.aspx), NN NNS from which are estimated to account for between 4 % and 6 % of the total UK NN footprint . The NNP NNP Organization has made clear the NN benefits of mitigating NN NN far outweigh the costs . 4 The US healthcare provider Kaiser Permanente announced in 2018 that it MD become NN neutral by 2020.5 Funders are increasingly supporting research into the NN effects of NN NN , typically with a focus on mitigation strategies . It seems unlikely that any JJ NN area will escape the pervasive anticipated and unforeseen consequences of NN NN . Noting that the epilepsies are strongly influenced by JJ factors , we wished to start to consider how NN NN might affect the epilepsies , to raise awareness within the epilepsy community of these issues , and to facilitate and promote efforts by NNS affected by epilepsy , families and carers , and epilepsy professionals , to begin to address what NN we can take . Individuals MD already be taking steps in their own private lives , for example , by working out their own NN footprint ( https://footprint.wwf.org.uk/#/ ‐ a very easy to use and enlightening tool ) and taking effective actions . 6 Patients , clinicians , and NNS across the NN , as a community , MD have ideas and initiatives for shared observations and mitigation measures to reduce the potential added burden of NN NN for those with epilepsy . We here consider the history of NN NN , review the current NN of NN and JJ efforts to tackle NN NN , describe how NN NN can affect JJ NN and NN , and then address the particular impacts there MD be on the epilepsies , how NN care in the epilepsies might contribute to NN NN , what can be done to mitigate the effects , and how progress might be achieved . 2 NN NN : A BRIEF SURVEY OF THE HISTORY AND CURRENT STATUS NN NN NN has a much longer history than most NNS realize , dating back to the 19th century when Joseph Fourier recognized that the NNP 's atmosphere kept the NN warmer than MD be the NN in a vacuum . He effectively discovered the NN effect : the passage of visible light waves through the atmosphere to the NN 's NN , their absorption , and re‐emission as infrared radiation , which can then be absorbed by certain types of gases in the atmosphere , increasing NN NNS . Eunice Newton Foote was the JJ to suggest that the NN effect of the NN MD be increased in the presence of NN dioxide ( CO : then called “ carbonic acid ” ) . Her work was presented by Professor Joseph Henry at the NNP Association for the Advancement of NNP meeting in August 1856 . John Tyndall then examined the absorption of infrared radiation in JJ gases , discovering the NN gases ( GHG ) CO , methane , and NN vapor in 1859 . Swedish scientist Svante Arrhenius was the JJ to link JJ activity to JJ NN . In 1896 , he published “ On the Influence of Carbonic Acid in the Air upon the NNP of the NNP , ” calculating that a doubling of atmospheric CO ( now called the “ NN sensitivity ” ) MD give a total NN of 5 ‐6 °C . In later work , he revised this downward to 4°C.7 This is not dissimilar to the range reported by the IPCC ’s 5th Assessment Report from the latest generation of JJ NN models . Events then jump almost 100 NNS to the modern era when the JJ conference on NN NN , a joint NNP Nations Environment Programme ( UNEP ) / NNP Meteorological Organization ( WMO ) / International Council for NNP ( ICSU ) Conference on the " Assessment of the Role of NNP Dioxide and Other NNP Gases in NNP Variations and Associated Impacts , " in 1985 concluded that GHG " are expected " to VB significant NN in the next century . This led to the establishment of the Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) in 1988 , whose role is to “ assess the scientific , technical and socio‐economic NN relevant for the understanding of the NN of human‐induced NN NN , ” and the NNP Nations Framework Convention on NNP NNP ( UNFCCC ) , an international JJ treaty adopted on NNP 9 , 1992 . The IPCC has issued a series of Assessment Reports once every 5 ‐6 NNS — published in 1990 ( NNP Assessment Report : FAR ) , 1995 ( Second Assessment Report : SAR ) , 2001 ( Third Assessment Report : TAR ) , 2007 ( Fourth Assessment Report : AR4 ) , and 2013 / 2014 ( Fifth Assessment Report : AR5 ) — and supplemental and special topic reports that describe the NN of scientific understanding at the NN each report is prepared . Although there have now been five Assessment Reports ( and the 6th is under construction ) , the range of potential NN with a doubling of atmospheric CO has not changed substantially from the estimate made with quite simple NN models in the FAR , or indeed by Arrhenius in 1896 , with both the FAR and AR5 suggesting a range from 1.5 to 4.5°C . Alongside this , the UNFCCC objective is to " stabilize NN gas concentrations in the atmosphere at a level that MD prevent dangerous anthropogenic interference with the NN NN . " The framework sets nonbinding limits on GHG NNS for individual NNS , with no enforcement mechanisms . An annual Conference of the Parties ( COP ) assesses progress in dealing with NN NN , and these have occurred since 1995 , with JJ producing specific international treaties ( “ agreements ” or “ protocols ” ) IN GHG NNS . This history includes ( a ) the Kyoto protocol — a legally binding agreement that industrialized NNS will reduce their NNS of GHGs , adopted in 1997 in Kyoto , Japan ; ( b ) the Copenhagen Accord ( 2009 ) , which recognized NN NN as CD of the greatest challenges of the present day and suggested actions should be taken to keep NN increases to below 2 °C ; however , the document was not legally binding and does not contain any binding commitments for reducing CO NNS ; ( c ) the Durban Platform ( 2011 ) , which included a decision to adopt a legally binding treaty on NN NN ; the treaty terms were to be set out by 2015 and become effective in 2020 and for the JJ NN , it included developing NNS and the NNP NNPS ; and ( d ) the Paris Agreement ( 2015 ) was a NN NN accord agreed by ~200 NNS in December 2015 that came into force on November 4 , CD , committing NN leaders to keeping JJ NN below 2 °C and pursuing a tougher target of 1.5°C . NN emission curbs are not legally binding , but the framework of the accord , including a mechanism for periodically increasing pledges , is binding . Since the FAR , the understanding of JJ influence on NN has improved through better NN observations and NN NN modeling , with the AR5 stating that : ( a ) “ NN of the NN NN is unequivocal , and since the 1950s , JJ of the observed NNS are unprecedented over decades to millennia " 8 ; ( b ) " Atmospheric concentrations of NN dioxide , methane , and nitrous oxide have increased to levels unprecedented in at least the last 800 CD NNS " 8 ; and ( c ) “ JJ influence on the NN NN is clear … It is extremely likely ( 95% ‐100 % probability ) that JJ influence was the dominant NN of JJ NN between 1951 ‐2010 . ” 8 Special reports such as the recent SR159 ( JJ NN of 1.5 °C ) examined the difference in impacts between 1.5 and 2 °C NN , suggesting that limiting NN to 1.5 °C “ is possible within the laws of chemistry and physics but doing so MD require unprecedented NNS ” with “ ‘ rapid and far ‐reaching ’ transitions in land , NN , industry , buildings , transport , and cities . ” A 1.5 °C limit MD require JJ net anthropogenic CO NNS to decline by about 45 % from 2010 levels by 2030 , reaching net zero IN 2050 . To limiting JJ NN to below 2°C , CO NNS will VB to decline by about 20 % by 2030 and reach net zero IN 2075 . We are already living in a 1 °C warmer NN . The SR159 NNS “ we are already seeing the consequences of 1 °C of JJ NN through more extreme NN , rising NN levels and diminishing Arctic NN NN , among other NNS … By 2100 , JJ NN level rise MD be CD cm lower with JJ NN of 1.5 °C compared with 2 °C , ” ; and moreover , “ JJ NN is likely to reach 1.5 °C between 2030 and 2052 if it continues to increase at the current rate ( high confidence ) . ” If we continue on our current emission trajectory , then we are likely to reach 2.6‐4.8 °C NN by 2100 , with recent modeling results suggesting that the higher NN sensitivities MD be more likely . In terms of personal emission targets , average personal NNS in 2010 were RB 5 tons per person and to reach the 2 °C target MD require reduction to RB 1.5 tons by 2050.10 This is very ambitious and of is of course VBN on an equal sharing of NNS across the JJ population . In reality , the rich , Westernized nations use much more NN per person than the poorer nations . CD There is the potential for major reduction in personal NN footprints in the Western NN typically by reducing the major contributors of car travel , heating , electricity use , and flying . Existing variability in NN influences JJ NN . For example , during clear summer days there is an increased occurrence of sunburn and Lyme NN , while during the winter , there is increased influence of influenza and falls . As NN NN will influence NN , particularly NN extremes , then impacts on JJ NN are likely . Hence , there has been an interest in the likely influence of NN NN on JJ NN for over 30 NNS , with a significant body of work now available on the NN impacts of NN NN . 11 - 15 NN NN MD lead to multiple NN impacts acting through a variety of JJ pathways , as shown conceptually in Figure 1 . Pathways through which NN NN MD influence NN . NN NN will affect mean NN , such as rainfall amounts and NN . In addition to changing average conditions , it MD RB increase variability and extremes ( eg , more intense rainfall events ) . The latter is probably of most consequence for JJ NN . Although globally , interannual NN has not increased in variability , 16 there is NN of regional NNS in extremes , 17,18 as both the mean NN and NN variability shift in response to anthropogenic forcings ( Figure 2 ) . These shifts in NN will be moderated by local JJ conditions and JJ NN , leading to NNS in three broad categories of exposure that have the potential to influence NN . The JJ are direct effects such as the influence of a heatwave upon mortality . CD The second are indirect exposures such as changing NN altering the growing season and distribution of plants , affecting pollen production , which in turn impacts on allergic disease20 ; other examples include changing NN patterns affecting mosquito breeding and NN cycles , leading to NNS in malaria and dengue fever ( VB below ) . 21 NNS in NN and humidity alter the geography of vector ‐borne diseases , by shifting vector breeding sites22 and altering the transmission windows of vector ‐borne diseases . 23 In JJ NNS , more NNS are needed to characterize the relationships between vector , pathogen , and NN . 24,25 Third , NN NN MD act through JJ and JJ disruption , for example , leading to mental NN effects from extreme events such as flooding26 or influencing JJ crop yields leading to increased hunger . 27 Flooding , whether coastal , fluvial , or pluvial , carries direct risks of drowning28 as well as a range of NN risks in the aftermath of the event , including the spread of NN ‐borne diseases , 29 and the spread of microbial contaminants in buildings . 30 The NN of exacerbating existing JJ conditions , through disrupted access to medicines and JJ facilities , is RB a concern . Schematic showing the effect on extreme NNS when ( A ) the mean NN increases , ( B ) the variance increases , and ( C ) when both the mean and variance increase for a normal distribution of NN However , changing exposure to extreme NN does not automatically lead to NN impacts , and the gray box in Figure 1 highlights the important moderating influence that NN care and wider JJ NN capability can have in ameliorating potential impacts . Put simply , appropriate NN care and JJ NN input can reduce NN impacts . It is important to recognize that these capabilities are dynamic over NN . Furthermore , they can respond ( ie , adapt ) to JJ situations . CD prominent example of such an NN occurred in response to the 2003 European heatwave during which over 70 CD additional deaths were recorded . CD City dwellers are at particular NN of heat stress given the urban heat island effect . 31 Modeling suggests that in summer 2003 , when an estimated 735 NNS died of causes relating to extreme heat in central Paris , anthropogenic NN NN increased the NN of heat ‐related mortality by approximately 70%,32 illustrating the scale of the issue . In response , JJ European NNS developed early warning systems for heatwaves and national advice and guidelines on NN to reduce potential NN impacts . 33 Adapting JJ NN capabilities will play an important role in responding to NN NN . The arrows in Figure 1 indicate feedback mechanisms between societal infrastructure , JJ NN , and NN measures and NN NN . Measures to reduce NN impacts MD RB reduce GHG NNS . Examples include the NN and JJ cobenefits of low NN diets . 34,35 Much of our understanding of likely impacts from NN NN in the coming decades comes from NN models . Atmosphere ‐Ocean General Circulation Models ( AOGCMs ) 36 use the laws of physics to compute atmospheric , oceanic , and other JJ variables , and represent JJ processes and interactions in the NN NN , at a series of evenly spaced “ cells ” or unit areas IN the globe . Although important tools in our understanding , they are complex and require considerable computational resource to run . For this reason , the cells VBN by NN ‐of ‐the‐art JJ NN models typically span a JJ area in order to reduce the number of calculations required : in turn , the outputs generated are coarse . While these outputs are useful for identifying JJ and regional trends , we VBP to adapt them for local use ( eg , to assess the likely impacts of NN NN in a particular coastal city or tropical community ) . This is accomplished VBG “ downscaling ” methods , 37,38 which involve VBG either statistical approaches or a higher resolution model over a limited area to add greater detail . 39,40 Unlike short‐term NN forecasts , which are dependent on the initial NN of the atmosphere , longer ‐term projections from NN models are largely dependent on trajectories of JJ development and on how fluctuating concentrations of GHGs impact the balance of sunlight absorbed by the NNP and NN radiated back into NN . Thus , these longer ‐term projections are subject to substantial uncertainty not related to the NN NN . In the most recent model simulations , these trajectories are characterized by the representative concentration pathways ( RCPs ) , 41 a comprehensive dataset of NNS to the NNP 's NN balance under JJ possible futures . However , RB when models are run with the same RCP , intermodel variability arises due to differences in how models represent processes , leading to JJ projected future NN NNS . For this reason , a multimodel ensemble is often VBN , in which uncertainty is considered to be represented by the spread of model projections . The various choices and inferences made at each stage of the modeling process can therefore yield a substantial envelope of uncertainty in local impacts . Yet , despite these uncertainties , consistent findings with relevance for epilepsy emerge . For instance , models agree exceptionally well on estimates of heat stress metrics , which combine NN and humidity . 42 Furthermore , each generation of models represents an advance in our understanding of NN processes and a refinement of modeled processes . For example , for a number of extreme NN indices , the spread among the most recent Coupled Model Intercomparison Project Phase 5 models ( CMIP5 ; CMIP is a collaborative framework for supporting assessments of NN NN and fostering model development , in which international modeling groups perform simulations VBN on preagreed scientific objectives , generating a database of model outputs with common standards ) is less than the spread among the previous generation CMIP3 models , RB though the project now contains more models . 43 The burden of JJ of these NNS will be felt by those least equipped to adapt . Models project increases in NN variability in Amazonia , Southern Africa , the Sahel , India , and South ‐East Asia over the coming decades . 44 In India , models RB indicate an intensification of heatwaves , with areas that do not currently experience heatwaves becoming severely affected this century . 45 Thus , models can VB us understand where we can expect the effects of NN NN to be most marked and what those effects might be , in turn helping us plan for the likely challenges that will VB to be addressed for NN care in general , and epilepsy in particular . As the NN NNS , we can expect there to be particular implications for epilepsy . These impacts might manifest at the level of altered NN of epilepsy per se , altered NN of seizures in established epilepsy , consequences for epilepsy treatments , and outcomes , with effects more likely to affect those not favored in the JJ place by geography and economics . We can expect inequalities in epilepsy NN care to be further exacerbated . NN NN leads to spread of vectors for infections , which is already being reported , and more can be anticipated . NN ‐driven hyperthermia , fevers , food and NN stress , and starvation MD further compound other difficulties as well as being directly relevant themselves . Moreover , while NNS are remarkably adaptable and have VBN niches in almost every terrestrial environment , NN NN will superimpose unprecedented rates and types of NN . A number of vector ‐borne infections can VB epilepsy or seizures in the acute phase . Chikungunya NN infection is associated with seizures as part of a multisystem acute illness in CD % of patients , 46 while there are NN reports of epilepsy as part of the chronic sequelae of neonatal chikungunya encephalitis .47 Epilepsia partialis continua has been reported with dengue encephalitis.48 Vertical Zika NN infection can lead to epilepsy RB in the absence of microcephaly , 49 and the epilepsy is typically drug‐resistant . 50 If NN NN leads to a spread of the vector carrying the infectious agent , then there will be an accompanying NN of spread of infection ‐related epilepsy or acute seizures . Predictions are difficult , because the impact of NN NN on vectors is multifactorial , and MD be further compounded by multiplier effects as well as actions taking to mitigate its effects . It is already the NN that the NN ‐sensitive diseases affect the poorest populations the most , with higher prevalence and greater mortality , for several reasons . 51 Outbreaks of vector ‐borne infections can easily overwhelm healthcare systems , for example , as shown by recent outbreaks of Ebola and Zika viruses , and emergence of infections in naïve populations or those that have lost immunity can be RB more dangerous . JJ factors related to NN NN can alter vector ranges , survival , biting behavior , pathogen infection capacity , and thus ultimately the NN of NN in NNS . NNS in rainfall patterns , drought‐rain cycles , and flood magnitude and frequency can all have effects , while JJ strategies to combat NN NN , such as reestablishment of wetlands and green spaces , can , perversely , promote vector spread . Accounting for these effects in model simulations is particularly challenging , but preliminary studies suggest , for example , that NN NN will favor the spread of dengue fever and other arthropod ‐borne infections given the NN sensitivity of JJ factors favoring the spread of infection . 52 NN , especially urban , effects of NN NN might lead to the spread of cysticercosis,53 neurological involvement from which is a major NN of epilepsy globally . A NN focusing on the NN of spread of vector ‐borne NN in the UK resulting from NN NN suggests that a 1 °C rise in NN MD permit Chikungunya NN transmission for 1‐3 months of the NN across most of southeast England by 2071 ‐2100 , with NNS in transmission ranges RB VBN for a range of other arthropods . 52 Malaria is caused by five NNS of Plasmodium transmitted by Anopheles mosquitoes . In malaria‐endemic areas , up to 90 % of the population MD have parasites detectable in their NN . Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax are associated with seizures and epilepsy , 54 particularly seizures during acute infections , and development of epilepsy has been documented following severe falciparum malaria . In addition , there is NN that asymptomatic malaria parasitemia can precipitate seizures in those with epilepsy . 55 There are JJ models of the effect of NN NN on the transmission of malaria , with the most significant and consistent effects predicted to occur in the highlands in Africa and parts of South NNP and South ‐East Asia .56 In other regions , the effect of NN NN on malaria transmission MD be minimal due to improved NN measures and socioeconomic factors , although the present decline in malaria transmission across the NN depends on continued support for the current NN measures . However , significant uncertainties exist in these models , particularly in the areas that experience malaria epidemics . Furthermore , most of these models examined the effect of NN NN on mosquitoes that carry P falciparum , but it is the Anopheles NNS that transmit P vivax ( particularly Anopheles atroparvus ) that are most likely to increase seizures and epilepsy in Europe . 57 For example , in CD model , a medium ‐high scenario of NN NN predicts that the southern half of Great Britain will be climatically suitable for P vivax malaria transmission by 2030 and by 2080 RB southern Scotland will be climatically suitable for 2 months of the NN . 58 Phenomena other than infections are RB worsening with NN NN . As conflicts arise , we can expect more head injuries as another NN of epilepsy . A NN from a highly polluted city in NNP suggests that transient increases in air pollutants such as nitrogen dioxide and sulfur dioxide are associated with increased hospital visits for epilepsy , supporting findings from another NN from Chile that reported an increased NN of hospitalization for epilepsy with increases in air pollutants . 59 Another NN identified a tentative link between higher relative air humidity and an increased NN of admission for an epileptic seizure ( though higher ambient NN was associated with a lower NN ) . 60 These are preliminary studies that suggest the relationships , if correct , are complex with a NN for more NNS . But , there is certainly a prevailing view that the outlook strongly favors strategies to forestall NN NN rather than trying to deal with the consequences on epilepsy and seizures of the complicated JJ NNS that will occur due to NN NN . NN can affect genes and proteins . Most genetic epilepsies are due to dysfunctional channels . As in much of epilepsy genetics , SCN1A is among the best studied in this regard . Some mutations in SCN1A that can VB epilepsy lead to defective folding of the encoded channel : Mutant channel insertion into a cell NN is NN ‐sensitive , for example , with increased insertion and current density at 30 °C compared to 37°C.61 Mutations in SCN1A can VB the rare , severe developmental and epileptic encephalopathy Dravet syndrome . While the effect of such dynamic NNS in the context of prolonged periods of higher ambient NN in thermoregulating NNS is difficult to predict , empirical and modeling NNS show direct effects of higher NNS on sodium channel biophysical properties and neuronal dynamics . 62 Elevated ambient NNS due to hot baths increase seizure frequency in Dravet syndrome . 63 Anecdotally , the UK Dravet syndrome patient support group reported that during the sustained atypical high ambient NNS of the summer of 2018 , affected NNS experienced more seizures and greater lethargy , in keeping with survey NNS from the Netherlands . 64 We previously reported the death of a young patient with Dravet syndrome who had been seizure ‐free , but had been walking outside on the hottest day in Melbourne ( Australia ) for NNS , with a peak of 46.5°C.65 There are other NN ‐sensitive epilepsies , though generally less well studied . An epilepsy ‐related mutation in SCN8A was associated with NN ‐sensitive NN expression and function . 66 Other genetic epilepsies with fever ‐induced seizures include those due to certain mutations in the genes GABRG2 , CHD2 , STX1B : NN elevation can affect brain thermal regulation and epileptiform discharges and induce seizures in models carrying certain mutations in GABRG2 67 or STX1B .68 Moreover , seizures in JJ epilepsies , of all types , are more frequent with psychological stress . NN NN is projected to increase population stress levels as it will affect mean NN , such as rainfall amounts and NN , but RB NN variability and extremes , probably of most consequence for JJ NN . There has been little research into the effects of NN NN on treatments for epilepsy . Lorazepam , VBN in JJ parts of the NN as an emergency treatment for seizures , is especially prone to degradation with higher mean kinetic NN . 69 There are few NNS on other antiepileptic drugs ( AEDs ) , and the summary of product characteristics for several commonly VBN AEDs do not include specific NN recommendations , while , for example , phenobarbital tablets should be stored below 25°C.70 Medication supply chains can be compromised RB today : It is easy to VB how disruption to infrastructure MD threaten AED ( and indeed any drug ) supply , as indeed happened after an exemplar ( but not NN NN ‐related ) disruption in a highly organized , well ‐developed economy in the Great East Japan earthquake of 2011.71 In addition , biodiversity loss is a feature of NN NN : This MD compromise sources , such as plant , microbial , and fungal NNS , from which the next antiepileptic drugs might emerge ( VB Figure 3 ) . Most NN NN projections anticipate that poverty is likely to increase , with disproportionate effects for those already most vulnerable . Thus , we can anticipate that the negative influence of epilepsy on socioeconomic status and all ‐cause NN of premature mortality will grow with NN NN independent of any direct effect on epilepsy biology . 7 WHAT CAN THOSE INVOLVED IN EPILEPSY DO ? Measures to address NN NN MD include attempts to reduce NN NNS , and actions for mitigation and NN . 1 For epilepsy professionals , there MD be steps that be included in daily practice . Raising awareness of NN NN , its impact for NNS with epilepsy and our contributions to NN NN is a start — the very purpose of this article . Concurrently , more research is required to investigate into NN NN and epilepsy , to better define the risks and develop adaptations and mitigations . Reduction of NN NNS ( “ decarbonizing ” ) MD begin with understanding the sources of NN NNS at the individual level and monitoring of individual NN contributions , for both professionals and NNS with epilepsy . Personal and SME NN NNS calculators are available RB ( examples include : https://www.carbonfootprint.com/calculator.aspx; https://footprint.wwf.org.uk/#/; https://www.carbontrust.com/resources/tools/carbon-footprint-calculator/). Among the key contributors for most NNS as professionals will be travel , consumption of food and goods , IT equipment , hotels , and restaurants , but this is not an exhaustive list and we invite other suggestions . Travel is likely to be a major contributor for JJ professionals and patients . Flying to conferences and meetings is likely to be an important component of contributions to NNS at the personal professional level . Flying in classes other than economy increases NNS significantly , for several reasons ( eg , VB http://blogs.worldbank.org/developmenttalk/blog-carbon-footprint-world-bank-group-staff-air-travel). Various websites , including some for academic travel in particular , can VB NNS calculate , reduce , or mitigate NNS ( eg , www.flyingless.org and https://thepointsguy.com/guide/a-guide-to-airline-carbonoffset-programs/). This is a difficult area , as clinical and scientific advances and stronger collaborations do emerge from face ‐to ‐face meetings , and teleconferencing still lacks both the personal touch and infallible reliability .
