text: NN activists and NN leaders have gathered this week in NNP NNP for the NNP Nations NNP Summit . But on Wednesday attention was focused across the Atlantic , where in Monaco the UN ’s Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP presented a special report on the “ unprecedented ” impact NN NN will have on the NN ’s oceans . It ’s not good . The report — compiled by over 100 authors from 36 NNS citing close to 7,000 accredited sources — paints a grim picture of the effect NN oceans and the cryosphere will have on humanity , especially if nothing is done to curb NNS . The ocean has played a critical role in warding off the effects of NN NN by absorbing close to 25 percent of CO2 NNS . The report warns that as the NN continues to rise and the ocean traps more heat , it will become more acidic , less oxygenated , less productive , less hospitable to NN , and more likely to give rise to tropical storms and hurricanes , which will occur with greater frequency and intensity . The report notes that with any additional degree of NN , intense NN events that VBD to occur once per century will in certain regions once per NN by the middle of the 21st century . Connected to the fate of the NN ’s oceans is the fate of the NN ’s frozen areas , or the cryosphere , on which close to 1.5 CD NNS ’s lives directs depend . As parts of the cryosphere melt ( glaciers , for instance ) , the JJ NN level will continue to rise , dramatically altering NN for those living in coast regions , if not making those regions uninhabitable . The NN level is rising twice as fast as it did during the 20th century , and that the rate is increasing , the report notes , explaining that the Antarctic NN sheet will contribute more to NN level rise by 2100 than was previously expected . In the next 80 NNS , the NN level MD increased by up to 60 centimeters if NN gas NNS are dramatically reduced , and 110 centimeters if they are not . It is n’t just glaciers and rising NN levels , either . As permafrost , snow , and NN melt , the frequency of landslides , avalanches , rockfalls , floods , and wildfires will increase . NN availability MD RB be thrown into flux as glaciers retreat , impacting agriculture . “ The NN ’s ocean and cryosphere have been ‘ taking the heat ’ from NN NN for decades , and consequences for nature and humanity are sweeping and severe , ” IPCC Vice Chair Ko Barett VBD in a statement . “ The rapid NNS to the ocean and the frozen parts of our NN are forcing NNS from coastal cities to remote Arctic communities to fundamentally alter their ways of NN . ” In August , the IPCC released a similarly dire report about the impact the NN NN will have on the JJ food supply . This extends well beyond traditional agriculture . The report released Wednesday explains that the “ JJ catch potential ” for fish MD decrease as the NN ocean becomes less hospitable to marine NN , and that communities that rely on seafood MD be in trouble . The only answer is to cut CO2 NNS and work toward more sustainable solutions . “ Cutting NN gas NNS will limit impacts on ocean ecosystems that provide us with food , support our NN and shape our cultures , ” IPCC Co-Chair Hans - Otto Pörtner , Co-Chair VBD in a statement . “ Reducing other pressures such as pollution will further VB marine NN deal with NNS in their environment , while enabling a more resilient ocean . ” Despite the realities detailed in the report , it was structured IN the idea that JJ of these consequences can be mitigated with “ timely , ambitious and coordinated NN ” to reduce NNS and pursue sustainable development . text: Nearly 50 NNS ago , three chemists named Mario Molina , Sherwood Rowland and Paul Crutzen VBD NN that chlorofluorocarbons , chemicals VBN as CFCs and released from aerosol sprays , were weakening the ozone layer that functions as the NN ’s natural sunscreen protecting NNS , animals and plants from harmful radiation . Aerosol NNS dropped dramatically , and , despite pushback from the chemical NNS that made CFCs , Congress in 1977 added protecting the ozone layer to the NNP Protection Agency ’s duties under the Clean Air Act . Not RB afterward , the agency determined that the compounds , then widely VBN in refrigerators , air - conditioners and some industrial processes , posed an RB graver threat to the atmosphere than RB thought . With the rest of the NN and RB industry on board , the result was the 1987 Montreal Protocol , a landmark agreement banning chlorofluorocarbons and other ozone - depleting chemicals . End of story ? Not quite . As it happened , the ozone - friendly replacements for the CFCs , VBN as hydrofluorocarbons , turned out to be distinctly unfriendly to the NN . So in CD , the Montreal signatories reconvened in Kigali , Rwanda , and agreed to amend the original protocol to phase out HFCs and find substitutes more friendly to the atmosphere . The bottom line is that the NN , confronted with CD dire threats to the NN ’s fragile atmosphere , VBD CD planetary responses with positive outcomes . The ozone layer is healing . text: The NNP Nations MD resort to JJ NN against NNS that defy its mandates on JJ NN NN , according to Ole Wæver , a prominent international relations professor at the NNP of Copenhagen . This urgency , he VBZ , MD lead to more abrupt – and essentially undemocratic – NN at an international level . “ If there was something that was decided internationally by some more centralised procedure and every country was VBN ‘ this is your emission target , it ’s not negotiable , we can actually take JJ measures if you do n’t fulfill it ’ , then you MD basically have to VB that down the throat of your population , whether they VBP it or not , ” he VBZ . “ A bit IN what we saw in southern Europe with NNS IN Greece and the debt NN and so on . text: NN NN is the JJ - term alteration in NNP ’s NN and NN patterns . It took nearly a century of research and NNS to convince the vast majority of the scientific community that JJ activity MD alter the NN of our entire NN . In the 1800s , experiments suggesting that JJ - produced NN dioxide ( CO2 ) and other gases MD collect in the atmosphere and insulate NNP were met with more curiosity than concern . By the late 1950s , CO2 readings MD offer some of the JJ NNS to corroborate the JJ NN NN . Eventually an abundance of NNS , along with NN modeling MD show not only that JJ NN was real , but that it RB presented a host of dire consequences . Dating back to the ancient Greeks , JJ NNS had proposed that NNS MD VB NNS and influence rainfall by chopping down trees , plowing fields or irrigating a desert . CD NN of NN effects , widely believed until the Dust Bowl of the 1930s , held that “ rain follows the plow , ” the now - discredited idea that tilling soil and other agricultural practices MD result in increased rainfall . Accurate or not , those perceived NN effects were merely local . The idea that NNS MD somehow alter NN on a JJ scale MD seem far - fetched for centuries . In the 1820s , French mathematician and physicist Joseph Fourier proposed that NN reaching the NN as sunlight must be balanced by NN returning to NN since heated surfaces emit radiation . But some of that NN , he reasoned , must be held within the atmosphere and not return to NN , keeping NNP warm . He proposed that NNP ’s thin covering of air — its atmosphere — acts the NN a glass NN MD . NN enters through the glass walls , but is then trapped inside , much IN a warm NN . Experts have since pointed out that the NN analogy was an oversimplification , since outgoing infrared radiation is n’t exactly trapped by NNP ’s atmosphere but absorbed . The more NN gases there are , the more NN is kept within NNP ’s atmosphere . But the so - called NN effect analogy stuck and some 40 NNS later , Irish scientist John Tyndall MD start to explore exactly what kinds of gases were most likely to play a role in absorbing sunlight . Tyndall ’s laboratory tests in the 1860s showed that coal gas ( containing CO2 , methane and volatile hydrocarbons ) was especially effective at absorbing NN . He eventually demonstrated that CO2 alone acted IN sponge in the NN it MD absorb multiple wavelengths of sunlight . By 1895 , Swedish chemist Svante Arrhenius became curious about how decreasing levels of CO2 in the atmosphere might cool NNP . In order to explain past NN ages , he wondered if a decrease in volcanic activity might lower JJ CO2 levels . His calculations showed that if CO2 levels were halved , JJ NNS MD decrease by about 5 degrees Celsius ( 9 degrees Fahrenheit ) . Next , Arrhenius wondered if the reverse were JJ . Arrhenius returned to his calculations , this NN investigating what MD happen if CO2 levels were doubled . The possibility seemed remote at the NN , but his results suggested that JJ NNS MD increase by the same amount — 5 degrees C or 9 degrees F . Decades later , modern NN modeling have confirmed that Arrhenius ’ numbers were n’t far off the mark . Back in the 1890s , however , the concept of VBG the NN was remote and RB welcomed . As Arrehenius wrote , “ By the influence of the increasing percentage of carbonic acid [ CO2 ] in the atmosphere , we MD hope to enjoy ages with more equable and better climates , especially as regards the colder regions of the NN . ” By the 1930s , at least CD scientist MD start to claim that NN NNS might already be having a NN effect . British engineer Guy Stewart Callendar noted that the NNP NNPS and North Atlantic region had warmed significantly on the heels of the Industrial Revolution . Callendar ’s calculations suggested that a doubling of CO2 in NNP ’s atmosphere MD warm NNP by 2 degrees C ( 3.6 degrees F ) . He MD continue to argue into the 1960s that a NN - effect NN of the NN was underway . While Callendar ’s claims were largely met with skepticism , he managed to draw attention to the possibility of JJ NN . That attention played a part in garnering some of the JJ NN - funded projects to more closely monitor NN and CO2 levels . Most famous among those research projects was a monitoring station established in 1958 by the Scripps Institution of Oceanography on top of Hawaii ’s Mauna Loa Observatory . Scripps geochemist Charles Keeling was instrumental in outlining a NN to record CO2 levels and in securing funding for the observatory , which was positioned in the center of the Pacific Ocean . NNS from the observatory revealed what MD become VBN as the “ Keeling Curve . ” The upward , saw tooth - shaped curve showed a steady rise in CO2 levels , along with short , jagged up - and - down levels of the gas produced by repeated wintering and greening of the Northern Hemisphere . The dawn of advanced computer modeling in the 1960s began to predict possible outcomes of the rise in CO2 levels made evident by the Keeling Curve . Computer models consistently showed that a doubling of CO2 MD produce a NN of 2 degrees C or 3.6 degrees F within the next century . Still , the models were preliminary and a century seemed a very JJ NN away . As more NNS became concerned about pollutants NNS were emitting into the atmosphere , some NNS theorized the pollution MD block sunlight and cool NNP . The idea that sunlight - blocking pollutants MD chill NNP caught on in the NN , as in a 1974 NNP magazine article titled “ Another NNP Age ? ” But as the brief cooling period ended and NNS resumed their upward climb , warnings by a minority of NNS that NNP was cooling were dropped . And in October 2018 , the U.N. 's Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP issued a report that concluded " rapid , far - reaching " actions are needed to cap JJ NN at 1.5 Celsius ( 2.7 Fahrenheit ) and avert the most dire , irreversible consequences for the NN . text: hinstrap penguins are exquisitely adapted to their environment . They live and breed in some of the NN ’s harshest conditions , nesting in the windblown , rocky coves of the Antarctic Peninsula , a strip of land comprising the northernmost part of the frigid continent . In NN they are precision hunters , darting after krill , the tiny shrimp - IN crustaceans that are their sole food source , utilizing barbed tongues engineered for catching the slipperiest of prey . On land , these 2 - 2.5 - NN - tall flightless birds are prodigious mountaineers , able to scale rocky escarpments in spite of their ungainly waddle . Their perfect NN to local conditions makes them the ideal barometer for the future of the region . If anything VBZ in the marine environment , the NN of chinstrap penguins will be CD of the most reliable indicators . They are the canaries of the Southern Ocean . And these endearing , black and white emissaries from Antarctic waters are starting to disappear . NNS conducting a chinstrap census along the Antarctic Peninsula have discovered drastic declines in JJ colonies , with some seeing population reductions of up to 77 % since they were last surveyed , about 50 NNS ago . The independent researchers , who hitched a ride on a Greenpeace expedition to the region , VBD that every single CD of the 32 colonies surveyed on Elephant Island , a major chinstrap outpost , had declined . Overall , the island ’s total chinstrap population had dropped by more than half , from 122,550 breeding pairs in 1971 to 52,786 in January 2020 . “ Such significant declines suggest that the Southern Ocean ’s ecosystem is fundamentally changed from 50 NNS ago , and that the impacts of this are rippling up the food web to NNS IN chinstrap penguins , ” VBZ Heather J. Lynch , associate professor of ecology & evolution at Stony Brook NNP in upstate NNP NNP , who designed the NN . “ There is something broken in the Southern Ocean , ” adds ornithologist Noah Strycker , a member of the penguin census team , and the author of the 2015 book . “ Our best guess on why that MD be is NN NN , which we VBP is hitting the Antarctic Peninsula region harder than …practically anywhere else in the NN except the Arctic . ” NN waters reduce the NN NN and the phytoplankton that krill depend upon for feeding and survival . Ocean acidification , a side effect of increasing JJ NN NNS , RB impacts their ability to reproduce . For the past five weeks Stony Brook NNS have joined forces with robotics and drone specialists from Boston ’s Northeastern NNP to survey relatively unstudied chinstrap penguin colonies along the western coast of the Antarctic Peninsula . Chinstraps prefer rocky , windblown sites for nesting , because they provide the best conditions for keeping eggs safe and dry . Those conditions make research difficult : the NNS endured freezing NNS , wind , rain and snow to reach the coastal rookeries by JJ inflatable motorboats , then scrambled among the colonies counting penguins by hand . The robotics team backed up the survey with drone footage . When they return to the lab , members of that team will use the findings to teach computers how to identify nests VBG artificial intelligence for NN in future surveys . The researchers surveyed 56 colonies in 37 days . So far , they ’ve only released numbers from the Elephant Island sites , which were the JJ to be surveyed . The final report will be published in a few weeks . But those initial findings appear to be consistent across most colonies . “ From whatever limited NNS we have from the 1980s , chinstrap populations appear to be down by over half , ” VBZ biologist Steve Forrest , the team lead on the expedition . On Jan. 31 , 2020 , 26 days into the expedition , Forrest motored IN the NNP ’s Head promontory on Snow Island to scout for potential survey sites . Some 30 NNS ago , researchers documented a colony there , but Forrest had heard rumors from passing boats that it had disappeared . The NN was too rough for a census that day , but it did n’t matter . Peering through a pair of binoculars , Forrest saw no NN that there were any penguins left on the island at all . “ I was hoping that we might find the colony after all , ” he VBZ . “ But not finding CD is more along the lines of what we expected . ” Some of the older surveys in the more difficult - to - reach areas are unreliable — conducted at a distance , by boat — so an exact assessment of how much has changed in the last three decades is impossible . Still , Forrest VBZ , he is confident that chinstrap populations are declining , particularly in the South Shetland Islands ( including Elephant Island ) off the coast of the Peninsula . “ I saw a lot of abandoned nesting places , so I am inclined to VB that it is a real decline , but the precise extent is uncertain . ” While the numbers of chinstraps MD be on the wane , the researchers saw a marked increase in gentoo penguin populations . Gentoos , which have red - orange beaks and lack the distinctive black band IN the throat that gives chinstraps their names , are much more flexible about what they eat and the conditions under which they breed . This means that they can more easily adapt to NNS in their environment . Forrest calls them “ NN NN winners ” for their ability to thrive in conditions that threaten chinstraps — at least in the short term . Strycker calls the process by which the upstarts take over chinstrap areas “ gentoofication . ” Strycker , a committed birder who chronicled his attempt to spot more than half the NN ’s bird NNS in a single NN in a 2017 book called Birding Without Borders : An Obsession , a Quest , and the Biggest NNP in the NNP admits that ultimately , it ’s not RB about the penguins . It ’s about krill . Krill are the foundation of the marine food NN — the fish that eat them are the fodder for the fish on which almost every ocean predator relies . The fish that we NNS eat RB primarily rely on krill as a food source . If krill populations are unhealthy , it means trouble down the line for everyone else . But krill , in their krillions , are hard to VB . That ’s where the chinstraps come in . IN certain whale NNS , chinstraps are krill specialists , but they are relatively easier to track compared to whales , with their erratic migration patterns . Chinstrap penguins reliably return to the same rookeries NN after NN to breed , so by assessing colony NN over NN , NNS can VB a better idea of how the krill they depend on are doing . Which is “ why we should care about a bunch of penguins VBG missing from a remote island that no NN ’s ever heard of , ” VBZ Strycker . “ Penguins give us an idea about what is VBG on in the ocean IN us . The ocean processes that are changing in the Antarctic are similar to the processes that are changing everywhere else in the NN . ” NNS MD not have evolved to catch krill the NN chinstraps do , but our fate is tied to the tiny crustaceans all the same .

text: Protecting the Environment and Addressing NNP NN at Home : November 2008 to January 2017 From the day he RB took office in January 2009 to the day he left office in January 2017 , NNP Barack Obama believed that no challenge posed a greater threat to our NNS , our NN , and future generations than NN NN . Indeed , as he saw it , acting on NN NN was a moral obligation of the present , not a distant problem of the future . And that ’s because , RB before NNP Obama assumed office , the NN was already changing in ways that — if left unchecked — MD have a profound impact on all of humankind . The scientific NN accumulated and reviewed over the past several decades showed unequivocally that the NN was NN , primarily due to JJ activities over the past 50 NNS . As a result , summers were becoming longer and hotter . Winters were becoming shorter and warmer . NN on land and in lakes and seas was melting . JJ NN levels were rising . And from storms , hurricanes , and heavy downpours to droughts , fires , and floods , extreme NN was becoming more frequent and intense . Simply put , NN NN was dramatically altering the NN — and altering it in ways detrimental to NN on NNP . This timeline tells the story of how the NNP and his team took NN to mitigate the impacts of NN NN and protect our environment at home . It documents the decisions made , as well as the challenges faced , by the Administration in its efforts to protect the air we breathe , the NN we drink , and the land that supports and sustains us . Above all , the timeline shows that — from reducing NN pollution and expanding the clean NN economy to increasing the resilience of communities to the impacts of NN NN to restoring ecosystems and preserving iconic landscapes — the NNP worked diligently to bring together Federal agencies , and all stakeholders , to tackle the greatest JJ challenges and JJ opportunities of our NN . • November 4 , 2008 – NNP - elect Obama pledged “ to build JJ partnerships to defeat the threat of the 21st century : terrorism and nuclear proliferation , poverty and genocide , NN NN and NN . ” • November 18 , 2008 – NNP - elect Obama pledged that “ My presidency will mark a JJ chapter in NNP ’s leadership on NN NN that will strengthen our security and create millions of JJ jobs in the process . ” • January 26 , 2009 – NNP Obama signed a memorandum directing the Department of Transportation ( DOT ) and the NNP Protection Agency ( EPA ) to begin working to update vehicle fuel economy standards . • April 1 , 2010 – The U.S. EPA and the Department of Transportation ’s National Highway Traffic Safety Administration ( NHTSA ) finalized a joint rule to establish a national program consisting of JJ standards for model NN 2012 through CD light - duty vehicles that will reduce NN gas NNS and improve fuel economy . • August 28 , 2012 – EPA and DOT issued NN gas and fuel economy standards covering passenger cars and trucks for model NNS 2017 – 2025 that will nearly double the fuel efficiency of those vehicles compared to JJ vehicles currently on our roads , saving households hundreds of millions of dollars at the pump and making the U.S. less reliant on fossil fuels . • Since 2009 , DOE ’s Building Technologies Office ( BTO ) has issued 58 JJ or updated appliance and equipment standards , which are projected to save consumers over $ 550 CD off their utility bills through 2030 , equivalent to saving the average family nearly $ 200 per NN , and cut NN dioxide NNS by nearly 3 CD metric tons . • February 17 , 2009 – NNP Obama signed into law the NNP Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 ( ARRA ) , which not only helped bring about a macroeconomic recovery but RB invested $ 90 CD in clean NN and NN efficiency , the largest single investment in clean NN in history . • In a retrospective analysis of the ARRA , published in February 2015 , the White NNP Council of NNP Advisers VBD that these investments transformed NNP ’s clean NN economy by supporting job creation , driving innovation , and scaling up renewable NN . In particular , through loan guarantees to support more than $ 40 CD of investment as well as tax credits , the Recovery Act spurred a major expansion of renewable NN generation through more than 100,000 projects across the country , including CD of the NN ’s largest wind farms and the JJ JJ scale solar projects . By the end of NNP Obama ’s JJ term , DOE and HUD completed efficiency upgrades in nearly CD CD homes , saving JJ families more than $ 400 on their heating and cooling bills in the JJ NN alone . • March 30 , 2009 – NNP Obama signed the Omnibus JJ Lands Management Act of 2009 , designating more than 2 CD acres of Federal wilderness , creating thousands of NNS of trails , and protecting more than 1,000 NNS of rivers . It marked the most extensive expansion of land and NN conservation in more than a generation • April 27 , 2009 – NNP Obama announced the Advanced Research Projects Agency for NNP ( ARPA -E ) , a high - NN , high - reward research program modeled after the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency ( DARPA ) to support transformative NN technology projects . • By February 2015 , ARPA-E had invested approximately $ 1.3 CD across more than 475 projects , which had generated over $ 1.25 CD in follow - on funding . ( Click here for more NN . ) • Annual patent filing for clean NN and pollution NN technologies has more than doubled since 2008 . • October 5 , 2009 – To lead by example , NNP Obama signed an Executive Order that set sustainability goals for Federal agencies that focused on improving their JJ , NN , and JJ performance . ( Click here for more NN . ) • Since the NNP took office , the Federal NN has : • Reduced NN gas NNS by nearly 18 percent , avoiding the emission of over 41 CD metric tons of NN pollution , equivalent to taking 8.7 CD cars off the road for CD NN ; • Cut NN use intensity at targeted federal facilities by more than 15 percent . The NN savings in 2015 alone resulted in a cost savings of $ 680 CD to taxpayers ; • Reduced NN consumption by more than 20 percent ; • More than doubled the amount of clean NN produced on Federal sites ; • Increased the number of Hybrid electric vehicles in the Federal fleet increased almost 12 - fold between 2008 and 2015 , from more than 1,700 to nearly 23,000 vehicles ; and • More than doubled the Federal fleet ’s consumption of alternative fuels , consuming more than 101 CD gallons since 2008 . The Department of These fuels are produced in the U.S. , decreasing our dependence on foreign oil and enhancing our NN security . • The Department of Defense launched the Great Green Fleet , a Navy Carrier Strike Group that deploys on alternative fuels . These fuels have been procured at prices that are on par with conventional fuels , and have demonstrated Navy ’s ability to VB farther , stay longer and deliver more firepower • February 3 , 2010 – NNP Obama established an Interagency Task Force on NN Capture and Storage . • 2009 to 2017 - DOE projects have safely sequestered more than 13 CD metric tons of NN dioxide – the equivalent of the NNS from CD CD passenger vehicles from the nation ’s roads for CD NN . • February 16 , 2010 – NNP Obama announced DOE loan guarantee to support JJ JJ nuclear reactor in decades . • June 24 , 2015 – The Department of NNP announced it will issue $ 1.8 CD in loan guarantees to three subsidiaries of the Municipal Electric Authority of Georgia ( MEAG NNP ) . The last of three conditional commitments , which , when combined with the previously issued $ 6.5 CD in loan guarantees to Georgia NNP NNP ( GPC ) and Oglethorpe NNP Corporation ( OPC ) , allow Vogtle , the JJ JJ nuclear NN plant to be licensed and begin construction in the U.S. in more than three decades , to be fully financed . • April 16 , 2010 – NNP Obama signed a Presidential Memorandum establishing the NNP 's Great Outdoors Initiative to promote and support innovative community - level efforts to conserve outdoor spaces and reconnect Americans to the outdoors . ( Click here and here for the NNP ’s remarks on the initiative , here for the Administration ’s NN plan , and here for progress reports . ) • April 20 , 2010 – In response to the Deepwater Horizon oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico , the Obama Administration launched the most aggressive and comprehensive reforms to offshore oil and gas regulation and oversight in U.S. history and put in place JJ safeguards to protect the environment . • 2010 - 2017 – After securing more than $ 16 CD in damages , criminal penalties and civil settlements from the NNS responsible for the spill of 3.1 CD barrels of oil , the Administration has already invested more than $ 1 CD in partnership with Gulf NNS for projects that restore barrier islands and coastal marshes and VBP enhance the valuable fisheries and recreation economy on which JJ Gulf communities depend . • NNP 21 , 2010 – The NNP signed a Presidential Memorandum in the Rose Garden , directing the U.S. NNP Protection Agency ( EPA ) and the U.S. Department of Transportation ( DOT ) to create a JJ - ever National Policy to increase fuel efficiency and decrease NN gas pollution from medium - and heavy - duty trucks for Model NNPS 2014 - 2018 . • August 9 , 2011 – The U.S. NNP Protection Agency ( EPA ) and the Department of Transportation ’s National Highway Traffic Safety Administration ( NHTSA ) finalized the JJ - ever program to reduce NN gas ( GHG ) NNS and improve fuel efficiency of heavy - duty trucks and buses . • July CD , 2010 – NNP Obama established the JJ comprehensive National Policy for the Stewardship of the Ocean , Our Coasts , and the Great Lakes . text: When a deadly NN that killed tens of thousands of European harbor seals in the northern Atlantic Ocean in 2002 began threatening NN lions , seals and otters in the northern Pacific Ocean , NNS were initially puzzled . text: Thousands of NNS IN the NN joined together last month to label NN VB the “ emergency ” that it is . But CD of the main points they make — linking NN of women ’s reproduction to JJ goals — is problematic . Focusing on what women in poor nations with the highest birth rates can do to curb NN NN distracts from holding wealthy NNS and corporations accountable for their disproportionate harm to the NN and imperils the NN to reproductive autonomy . The paper , “ NNP NNPS ’ Warning of a NNP Emergency , ” was published in early November on the 40th anniversary of the JJ NN NN conference . It rightfully warns of “ untold suffering ” without “ major transformations in the ways our JJ society functions . ” Reducing population growth is CD of six steps the authors VBP MD slow NN dioxide NNS . They RB argue that to decrease the birthrate , family planning services and primary and secondary education VBP to be more available and accessible . The group ’s website goes a JJ step further . It VBZ families must be encouraged to have fewer NNS and sounds the overpopulation alarm . A startling graph shows a dramatic NN population spike beginning in the 19th century . The accompanying text refers to NNS giving birth as “ adding more NN emitters to the NN . ” This presents a troubling and unfair picture and promotes the scapegoating of women . Access to family planning and education are essential to gender equity and must be fiercely promoted in their own NN . But arguing that they are an instrument against NN NN implies that the most disenfranchised have an outsize role to play in the fight because of higher birth rates , when in reality they contribute very little to NN gas NNS . High - and upper - middle - income NNS have higher per-capita NNS and account for 86 % of JJ NN NNS , despite having the lowest fertility rates . And RB though some observers argue JJ development will lead to higher per-capita NN NNS from poor NNS in the future , the JJ scientific and policy communities ’ response should be laser - focused on bold systemic NNS , such as restraining the use of fossil fuels , rather than persuading NNS to have fewer NNS . Emphasizing population reduction as a response to JJ NN is RB problematic because it MD provide a perverse incentive for family planning services to lose sight of NNS ’s NN to make their own decisions about contraception and childbearing . The NNS ’ warning rightly VBZ that family planning programs should be voluntary and ethical , but those concepts can start to blur when women ’s choices are put in competition with the future of the NN . Historically , population growth alarmism coupled with eugenic ideas about who is worthy of reproducing has led to a painful JJ legacy of coercion and abuse — including , most prominently , NNS of forced sterilization in India and NNP ’s CD - NN policy . Such blatant examples have been less common in the NNS since the landmark 1994 International Conference on Population and Development marked a shift away from population NN toward protecting reproductive NN and rights . However , those ideas have n’t died . Just four NNS ago , Stanford NNP biologist Paul Ehrlich , who wrote the 1968 book “ The Population Bomb , ” VBD he MD endorse “ various forms of coercion ” to keep NNS from having more NNS . An inherent and unresolvable tension remains between viewing family planning as a tool to mitigate NN NN and valuing an individual ’s NN to choose to have a NN . Framing family planning as a means to an end — especially when the “ end ” is as urgent and important as slowing NN NN — MD lead anxious policymakers and healthcare providers focused on reducing population to push contraceptive methods that are considered more effective , without regard for a woman ’s needs and preferences . It MD RB lead them to be less likely to make sure women are able to have provider - controlled methods — such as intrauterine devices or contraceptive implants — removed on demand . Curbing NN NN and making high - quality , rights - VBN contraception and abortion services accessible to those who VBP them are both urgent issues that deserve attention and resources . However , the misplaced emphasis on poor women ’s reproduction risks sacrificing JJ rights to chip away at NN NN , a massive problem that needs transformational solutions . And it RB distracts from the fact that poor communities are the least likely to have the resources to mitigate the devastating impact of NN NN on their lives and livelihoods , and thus have the most to lose . RB if women in poor NNS stopped having NNS tomorrow , without massive decarbonization of the economy neither the NN nor their lives will be any better off now or in the future . As NN - NN NNS continue to push the NN toward urgent NN , they should avoid family planning as a solution . Instead , they can follow the lead of the NN justice movement and promote a JJ - rights - VBN approach that holds governments and businesses accountable for reducing reliance on fossil fuels — and for mitigating the disproportionate burden borne by the most poor and disenfranchised . A bold vision for tackling the NN emergency requires nothing less . Kelsey Holt is a JJ and behavioral scientist and researcher with the Person - Centered Reproductive NNP Program at UC San Francisco .

text: The federal NN is ill - prepared to shoulder what MD be a trillion - dollar fiscal NN associated with extreme NN , floods , wildfires and other NN disasters through 2100 , federal investigators have VBN . In the latest of a series of reports , the NNP Accountability Office VBZ that costs of disaster assistance to taxpayers since 2005 have swelled to nearly $ 500 CD — and they keep getting higher . “ The federal budget , however , does not generally account for disaster assistance provided by Congress or the JJ - term impacts of NN NN on existing federal infrastructure and programs , ” GAO VBD in the 16 - page report , which was presented as testimony to Congress by Alfredo Gómez , director of the office ’s natural resources and environment team . Moreover , the NN “ does not have certain NN needed by policymakers to VB understand the budgetary impacts of such exposure , ” GAO VBD . The findings follow a dramatic escalation in federal spending on disaster assistance since 2005 . Much of that NN — upward of $ 450 CD — has been appropriated under supplemental spending packages following disasters rather than through the normal budgetary process . In 2018 , Congress approved $ 91 CD in disaster spending to VB communities recover from hurricanes , floods , wildfire and drought . The outflow of disaster dollars has continued into 2019 ; Congress has passed bills authorizing an additional $ 19.1 CD , according to federal figures . The growing frequency and intensity of disasters is being felt in every region of the country and across a broad cross-section of the economy , from NN and real estate to farming and fisheries . The report includes 21 examples of NN NN ’s JJ impacts , most of which will place additional strain on federal resources . They include infrastructure damage in coastal zones from NN - level rise and storm surges , increased heat - related mortality in the Southeast and Midwest , NNS in NN supply and demand in the West , and decreased agricultural yields in the southern Plains and Southwest . GAO RB identified CD types of potential benefits from NN NN : fewer deaths from cold NN in the Upper Midwest and improved agricultural yields in the northern Great Plains and parts of the Northwest , mainly associated with longer growing seasons . Financial exposure to NN disasters will be felt hardest in three pots of NN spending : disaster response , flood and crop insurance , and operation and management of federally owned property and JJ lands . Investigators noted that the National Flood Insurance Program , for example , owes the U.S. Treasury $ 21 CD associated with massive payouts to flood victims dating back to 2005 . Similarly , the Congressional Budget Office estimated in NNP 2019 that federal crop insurance MD cost the NN an average of about $ 8 CD annually from 2019 through 2029 due to worsening floods , droughts and other NN stressors . Federal properties , IN Tyndall Air Force Base on the Florida Panhandle , are RB facing increased financial exposure from hurricanes and other extreme NN events , GAO VBD . Hurricane Michael virtually destroyed Tyndall in 2018 , and its reconstruction is estimated to cost more than $ 4 CD ( Climatewire , July 3 ) . Rob Moore , a senior policy analyst and expert on NN NN and resilience at the Natural Resources Defense Council , VBD GAO ’s findings are consistent with previous warnings from financial experts that the costs of NN disasters are far exceeding the NN ’s ability to pay . Federal agencies “ are still treating these disasters as random events . We just throw a bunch of NN at them after the fact and assume they wo n’t happen again . The problem is we ’re having these types of disasters every NN now , ” Moore VBD . Spending hundreds of billions of dollars in disaster - specific supplemental relief cannot continue , he added . “ We VBP to both start accounting for the growing NN to respond to disasters within the regular appropriations process , ” Moore VBD . “ More importantly , we VBP to start making investments that reduce our exposure and vulnerability to these types of damages . ” Reprinted from Climatewire with permission from E&E NNP . text: Antarctica Breaks 69 °F for the JJ NN on Record The Antarctic region just recorded a NN higher than 20 degrees Celsius ( 68 degrees Fahrenheit ) for the JJ NN . Brazilian NNS measured a NN of 20.75 degrees Celsius ( approximately 69.35 degrees Fahrenheit ) on Seymour Island Feb. 9 , CD of the researchers VBD AFP Thursday . The record was broken three days after the Antarctic continent recorded its highest NN to date at a balmy 18.3 degrees Celsius ( approximately 64.9 degrees Fahrenheit ) . That measure was taken at Argentina ’s Esperanza station on the Antarctic peninsula that extends north towards South NNP . The Brazilian reading was taken on CD of the islands that extends off that peninsula , according to BBC NNP . It breaks the previous record for the entire Antarctic region , defined by the NNP Meteorological Organization ( WMO ) as all the land and NN south of 60 degrees . The previous record for the region of 19.8 degrees Celsius ( approximately 67.6 degrees Fahrenheit ) was recorded in 1982 on Signy Island . Schaefer was careful to point out that the NN reading was not part of a larger NN and so MD not be VBN as NN of a NN trend . However , Antarctica as a whole has warmed by almost three degrees Celsius over the past 50 NNS , according to WMO NNS reported by BBC NNP . During that NN , about 87 percent of the glaciers on its western coast have retreated . The region RB just recorded its warmest January on record . Schaefer works as part of Brazil ’s Terrantar project that studies 23 sites in Antarctica . NNS on the peninsula , the South Shetland Islands and the James Ross archipelago cooled during the JJ decade of the 21st century , and then began to rise quickly , he VBD The Guardian . The peninsula and its surrounding islands have been the areas of Antarctica most impacted by the NN NN so far , which means they might indicate how the rest of the region will react . If all of the NN in Antarctica were to melt , it MD VB 50 to 60 meters ( approximately 164 to 197 NNS ) of NN level rise . This MD take centuries , however . text: U.S. stocks and indices have lifted to JJ highs in a dramatic recovery from the initial wave of NN fears but the NN ’s NN markets have not , dropping the WTI crude oil futures contract to the lowest low since January 2019 . Worse yet , it ’s now testing psychological and technical support at 50 for the fourth NN in 13 months , raising odds for a breakdown that brings the deep December 2018 at 42.36 into play . As a consumer , you might VB that cheap crude oil prices are great for the economy and your family ’s bottom line . However , the contract is a highly - cyclical instrument that tracks JJ expansion and contraction with surprising accuracy . RB now , the selloff is waving a red flag , telling us that NN traders are worried that NN economies will enter recessionary waves as a result of NNP ’s isolation and the potential escalation into other parts of the NN . More importantly from a technical standpoint , a decline into the 2018 low will mark the next phase in a massive 17 - NN descending triangle pattern , with support at the 2009 low in the lower 30s . The contract last tested that critical level in early CD , breaking down into the mid-20s before reversing gears and remounting broken support . It ’s failed to post a higher high in the last 4 NNS , maintaining a secular downtrend that ’s now entered its 12th NN . NN activists MD view crude oil ’s decline as a positive development , with more industries moving away from fossil fuels and into NN - neutral NN sources . However , it ’s unlikely that paradigm shift has reached critical mass , given healthy demand as a result of the multiyear JJ expansion . In addition , dwindling crude oil resources IN the NN in coming NNS is likely to generate a premium for the commodity , with remaining NNS forced to pay up due to lower supply . Fortunately , the evolution of crude oil prices has been moving at a snail ’s pace , telling NN players there ’s plenty of NN to take NN if exposed to the industry through NN stocks or the futures markets . However , as we learned in 2008 , contract volatility can escalate rapidly in response to NN shocks IN that NN ’s JJ collapse , so it makes sense to keep a watch on NN NN at all times . The contract soared from the mid-teens into the lower 40s in just 4 months in 1990 , driven higher by the JJ Iraqi invasion . It settled back to NN a few months later , reentering a multiyear trading range that broke to the upside once again in 2004 when NN economies were getting back on the NNS after the burst Internet bubble . The uptrend went parabolic in 2006 , driven by heavy speculation as a result of NNP ’s multi-trillion dollar industrial expansion . A vertical plunge followed 2008 ’s all - NN high at 147.47 , dropping the contract into a test at breakout support in the JJ quarter of 2009 . It made steady progress into 2011 , finally reversing a few points under the .786 Fibonacci selloff retracement level . That marked the highest high in the last 9 NNS , ahead of a broad trading range that broke to the downside in 2014 . That selloff printed the JJ lower monthly high for the contract in more than CD decades . The decline VBD support at the 2009 low at the start of CD , giving NN to a healthy uptick that stalled after NNP NNP fired the JJ shot of the trade NN in 2018 . It printed the second lower high in 7 NNS at that NN , turning south at the .50 retracement of the 2 - NN slide . This downturn VBD support in the low 40s at the end of the NN but the contract failed to make headway in 2019 and MD be headed into a critical test at the CD low . The WTI crude oil contract MD have entered the next phase of a massive descending triangle pattern that forecasts much lower prices in coming decades . text: ouTube has been “ actively promoting ” videos containing misinformation about NN NN , a report released Thursday by campaign group Avaaz claims , despite recent policy NNS by the platform intended to drive NNS away from harmful NN and NN NNS . Avaaz examined 5,537 videos retrieved by the search terms “ NN NN , ” JJ NN ” and “ NN manipulation , ” and then the videos most likely to be suggested next by NNP ’s “ up next ” sidebar . For each of those search terms respectively , 8 % , 16 % and 21 % of the top 100 related videos included by NNP in the “ up - next ” feature contained NN that goes against the scientific consensus on NN NN – such as denying NN NN is taking place , or claiming that JJ activity is not a NN of NN NN . Avaaz claims this promotion process means NNP is helping to spread NN denialism . “ We ’ve VBN that it ’s very likely that at least CD in five NNS who search for a term IN JJ NN or NN NN MD be sent down this type of misinformation rabbit hole , ” VBZ Fadi Quran , a campaigns director at Avaaz , and CD of the report ’s authors . “ NNS are working so hard to educate NNS about the existential threat we face and NNP is allowing bad actors among us the last word on this issue for JJ NNS . ” Smaller scale studies have previously suggested that a majority of NN - related videos on NNP oppose the scientific consensus on NN NN . The “ up next ” feature dictates what NNS watch for 70 % of the NN they spend on NNP . The exact make - up of the NNP algorithm that drives recommendations , designed to keep NNS on the platform for as RB as possible , is a closely guarded secret . Experts VBP the algorithm appears to have learned that radical or outrageous NN is more likely to engage viewers . When it comes to NN NN , Avaaz VBZ , that leads to the promotion of controversial videos with titles such as “ JJ NN is a hoax ” and “ ACTUAL SCIENTIST : NNP NN is a Scam ! ” The algorithm is RB personalized to each user , meaning that after you watch CD NN containing NN misinformation , it is more likely to recommend another for you . In January 2019 , responding to criticism over the platform ’s tendency to drive NNS towards more radical JJ and JJ viewpoints , NNP announced that in the U.S. it MD begin reducing recommendations of “ borderline ” NN that pushed the limits of Community Guidelines on areas IN hate speech , as well as “ NN that MD misinform NNS in harmful ways — such as videos promoting a phony miracle cure for a serious illness , claiming the NN is JJ , or making blatantly JJ claims about historic events IN 9/11 ” . In December , NNP VBD that policy had been successful , driving down the average NN spent by U.S. NNS watching recommended “ borderline ” NN or harmful misinformation by 70 % . But Quran VBZ it remains unclear if that policy is effectively applied to NN denialist NN . “ They VBP all scientifically inaccurate NN that causes harm is included under that policy — which should indicate that NN denial is part of it , ” he VBZ . “ However [ NNP ’s parent NN ] is not transparent and our research so far indicates that NN denial videos are still being actively recommended . Either their downgrading tools are not working as they should , or they have decided to exclude NN denial from the NN . ” A NNP spokesperson tells NN , “ We ca n’t speak to Avaaz ’s methodology or results , and our recommendations systems are not designed to filter or demote videos or channels VBN on specific perspectives . ” They add that NNP ’s systems “ prioritize authoritative voices for millions of NN and NN queries , and NN NN panels on topics prone to misinformation — including NN NN — to provide NNS with context alongside their NN ” and that the systems appear to have done so “ in the majority of NNS in this report ” . Ads for major brands appeared alongside the videos containing NN misinformation seen by Avaaz . The campaign group claims that by promoting NN denial videos to drive more viewing NN , and by placing ads alongside these videos , NNP is profiting from the spread of misinformation . The NNP spokesperson VBZ they have “ strict ad policies that govern where ads are allowed to appear and we give advertisers tools to opt out of NN that does n’t align with their brand . ” Pressure from advertisers , some of whom Avaaz informed about their findings , MD potentially push NNP to take more NN on NN denial NN . An advertising boycott in 2017 , when brands sought to prevent their ads appearing alongside extremist NN , cost Google millions of dollars in revenue , and helped drive NNP to strengthen efforts to limit how often its platform surfaced extremist NN . ( As well as reducing the promotion of borderline NN , in June , the platform began removing thousands of videos displaying white supremacism and other hateful ideologies . ) Stephan Lewandowsky , chair of the cognitive psychology department at the NNP of Bristol , who studies NN misinformation , VBZ the question is n’t whether NNP MD deal with NN denialism on its platform , but whether there the NN ’s leadership have the JJ will to do so when there is not yet “ JJ consensus ” in all NNS IN NN NN . “ With the radical Islamist and the white supremacist material [ that NNP has been successful in policing ] , they recognized that was something they definitely MD n’t VB away with [ hosting ] , ” he VBZ . “ With NN denial , RB though it is a scientifically totally absurd position , there are plenty of politicians in the U.S. and Australia , for example , who are immersed in this stuff . ” Misinformation IN NN NN and its impacts are still commonplace in some prominent mainstream NN . On Jan. 14 , James Murdoch , son of Australian NN mogul Rupert Murdoch , criticized the “ ongoing denial ” of the NN NN displayed by his father ’s NN outlets , particularly in coverage of Australia ’s current bushfire NN . For Lewandowsky , the promotion of NN denialism , both in the NN and to NNP NNS searching for NN about NN NN , creates a major stumbling block to JJ momentum on cutting NN gas NNS . “ For JJ NNS who are not trained NNS , ” he VBZ , “ the moment they ’re exposed to what appears to be a scientific debate — but is n’t actually , because the NN was settled a JJ NN ago — they feel they can VB “ Oh , well , the NNS do n’t agree on this — we do n’t have to do anything . ” Sign up for CD . text: The real NN debate is not between “ believers ” and “ deniers ” . And not between Republicans and Democrats . The real debate is certainly not over whether JJ NN , spurred by increasing NN gases , is a serious problem that must be addressed . Both sides of the real NN debate agree on that . The real rebate is between CD groups : 1 . A confident , non-political group that believes technology , informed investments , rational decision making , and the use of the best scientific NN will lead to a solution of the JJ NN issue . An optimistic group that sees JJ NN as a technical problem with technical solutions . I will refer to these folks as the ACT group ( Apolitical / Confident / Technical ) 2 . A group , mainly on the JJ left , that is highly partisan , anxious and often despairing , self - righteous , JJ on blame and JJ justice , and willing to attack those that disagree with them . They often distort the truth when it serves their interests . They RB VBP JJ NN as necessary for dealing with JJ NN , requiring the very reorganization of society . I call these folks the ASP group ( Anxious , JJ - Justice , Partisan ) . There is no better NN to VB the profound difference between these CD groups than to watch a NN of the testimony of young activists at the recent NNP Hearing on NNP NNP , which included Greta Thunberg , Jamie Margolin , Vic Barrett , and Benji Backer . Jamie Margolin of Seattle talked about an apocalyptic future , with “ corporations making billions ” while they destroy the future of her generation . Of feeling fear and despair . Of a NN where the natural environment is undergoing collapse , where only a few NNS are left before we pass the point of no return , and where only a massive JJ shift can fix things , including the Green NNP Deal . Watch her testimony to VB what I mean . Compare Ms. Margolin ’s testimony to that of NNP of NNP senior Benji Backer . Mr. Backer , leader of the NNP Conservation Coalition , a conservative / moderate group of young NNS supporting NN to protect the environment , approaches the problem in a radically JJ NN . Instead of despair , there is optimism , recommending more scientific and technical research , a bipartisan attack on the problem , a rejection of an apocalyptic future , the building of JJ NN industries with potential benefits for the JJ economy , and a dedication to follow the NN and not JJ expediency . His testimony is here . Both Ms. Margolin and Mr. Backer care deeply about the environment and VBP effective measures to deal with JJ NN . Both their approaches and attitudes MD not be more JJ . We VBP the difference between the optimistic ACT group and the despairing ASP folks here in Seattle . On CD hand , there is the Clean Tech Alliance , which brings together technology NNS , NN researchers , and the business community to develop and apply the technologies that will produce the NN - free future we look for . Headed by Tom Ranken , the Alliance does a lot , including a highly informative breakfast series where you can learn about fusion NN , JJ battery technologies , the future of solid waste recycling , and much more . Non-political , optimistic , and exciting . These are clearly members of the ACT group . In contrast , there is Seattle ’s 350.org group . They are into NN strikes , staging protests ( IN their recent blockade of a branch of Seattle Chase Bank ) , trying to muzzle NN NNS they do n’t VB , advocating JJ solutions to NN NN ( Green NNP Deal ) , pushing divestment of NN NNS , and RB a Pledge of Resistance to stop NN exports by whatever means necessary . Their “ NN ” page has all kinds of extreme ( and unfounded ) claims regarding JJ NN impacts , IN a NN level rise of CD NNS in as little as 50 NNS . ASP group all the NN . I should note that the Seattle 350.org group and their “ allies ” oppose the Tacoma Liquid Natural Gas ( LNG ) Facility that will VB replace the extraordinarily dirty “ bunker fuel ” VBN in ships traversing Puget Sound . LNG will RB reduce NN NNS . NNS and regulators at the Puget Sound Clean Air Agency support the LNG facility . But facts and protection of the NN of Puget Sound residents are not priorities for highly politicized groups IN 350.org . A good example of the differences between the ACT and ASP folks is VBN in NNP NNP ’s recent NN initiatives . Initiative 732 was backed by NNP NNP , a non-political group whose bi-partisan proposal MD have increased the NN of NN fuels but was revenue neutral , giving all the funds collected back to the citizens of the NNP . Carefully designed and impactful . The work of the ACT group all the NN . But the ASP folks were unhappy . There was no NN for their NN justice and JJ initiatives , so they opposed it , and were joined by Governor Inslee and the JJ left . Unforgivable , nasty attacks were made on NNP NNP leadership by the ASP folks . 732 lost . The ASP collective decided it was their turn , so they created a Frankenstein NN initiative ( 1631 ) , with a lowered ( less effective ) NN fee , but CD in which NN justice groups and JJ allies on the left MD have NN , and were hardwired for much of the funds . The main advertising line of the 1631 ads : catastrophe was IN the corner and the JJ oil NNS were to blame . 1631 was an NN day disaster , losing by 13 points , and the ASP folks have probably killed any hope for an effective NN tax / fee in our NN . What about the NN ? Which side are they on ? ASP or ACT or neither ? Much of the “ mainstream ” NN parrots the message of the ASP side . The Seattle Times is a great NN in point , with headlines of massive heat related deaths ( 750 die per event ! ) and catastrophic wildfire seasons that have no basis in good NN . But there are plenty of others , such as the LA Times and the NY Times . There are some major NN outlets that are more balanced ( such as the Wall Street Journal ) . A major issue for the NN is the hollowing out of NN reporting , with most NN stories being handled by general reporters with neither the NN , background , or inclination to VB beyond parroting the press releases of activist groups or evaluating the claims of speculative research papers . It has gotten so bad that a recent headline story in the Seattle Times kept on talking about the WRONG GAS ( NN monoxide instead of NN dioxide ) . A Religious Movement In JJ ways , the ASP group appears to be a religious movement , not unlike the JJ millennialist movements of the past . As other groups in the past , they predict an apocalyptic future ( including fire and brimstone ! ) and that PRP must “ VB ” in their viewpoint or be rejected as a “ denier . ” The ASP folks have a holy viewpoint that comes from authority ( they claim VBN on the views of 97 % of NNS ) . There is no debate allowed , the NN is “ settled . ” Sounds IN religious dogma . The ASP movement describes a NN that is teetering on the edge , with mankind ’s days numbers ( CD or 12 NNS according to several of their leading prophets ) unless immediate steps are taken . They constantly repeat that the threat is existential . They VBP it is ok to distort the truth to VB folks “ to do the JJ thing . ” The ASP group has well defined “ enemies ” that represent JJ evil ( NNP , Republicans , NNP Oil , Koch Brothers ) and they support attacking and silencing those they disagree with ( my past blog gives you some documented examples of such behavior ) . ASP has their priests ( NNP Gore , NNP McKibben , Michael Mann ) and RB young saints ( Greta Thunberg ) . As in JJ such movements , members are guided to act in approved and enlightened ways , but the leadership does not VB to follow the rules ( e.g. , JJ ASP “ leaders ” have huge NN footprints from flying ) . Importantly , ASP sees their work VBG much further than a technical fix for technical problem , but as a “ JJ justice ” movement that will VB the very organization of society . Disturbingly , the ASP folks are against key technologies that MD RB make a difference , such as nuclear NN , and are relatively uninterested in working on NN and resilience to NN NN . JJ do not support dealing with our forests in a rational NN ( e.g. , restoration with thinning and prescribed burning ) but MD rather blame it all on JJ NN . By pushing a highly JJ agenda the ASP movement is undermining bipartisan efforts–and nothing important will be done unless both sides of the aisle are involved . ASP folks love to VB that the Republicans are unwilling to deal with NN NN , a totally unfair claim . I have talked personally to leading WA Republicans , IN NNP Bryant and Rob McKenna . They acknowledge the seriousness of JJ NN and the NN to act . In my talks in highly Republican eastern NNP , growers and others accept the problem and VBP to work on solutions . Under a Republican U.S. Congress , funding for NN research has been protected and increased . But partisan attacks by the ASP group is seen as a NN to promote group cohesion and the “ evil ” of the other side . Calling others names is not an effective NN to secure their cooperation . A problem for the ASP group is that their message is so dark , pessimistic and depressing that it tends to turn others off . And it has a terrible psychological effects on its adherents and those that listen . Fear , anxiety , feelings of hopelessness , despair , and rage . There are RB classes on dealing with eco-anxiety and NN grief . Greta Thunberg VBD that the worry ruined her childhood . And yes , there is NNP NNP . Much of what he VBZ on NN NN is simply nonsensical , and quite frankly he is not part of the debate . Republicans in Congress do not follow his lead . But he is a convenient foil for the ASP folks , who use him for their own purposes . The Bottom Line Progress on NN NN is being undermined by the efforts of the highly vocal , partisan , and ineffective ASP group . They are standing in the NN of bipartisan NN on NN NN , efforts to fix our forests , and the use of essential technologies . They are a JJ part of the problem , not the solution . In contrast to the ASP folks , the ACT group generally tries to stay out of the JJ eye , quietly completing the work needed to develop the technologies and infrastructure that will allow us to mitigate and adapt to NN NN . In the end , they will save us . That is , if the ASP folks do n’t VB in their NN . The above article is from Wattsupwiththat.com . Visit Wattsupwiththat.com for more great articles .

text: The path of future NN NN will depend on what courses of NN are taken by society — in particular the emission of NN gases from the burning of fossil fuels . A range of alternative NNS scenarios VBN as representative concentration pathways ( RCPs ) were proposed by the IPCC in the Fifth Assessment Report ( AR5 ) , which was published in 2014 , to examine potential future NN NNS . The scenarios depend on various assumptions concerning future rates of JJ population growth , JJ development , NN demand , technological advancement , and other factors . Unlike the scenarios VBN in previous IPCC assessments , the AR5 RCPs explicitly account for NN NN mitigation efforts . Graph of the predicted increase in the concentration of NN dioxide ( CO 2 ) in NNP 's atmosphere according to a series of NN NN scenarios that assume JJ levels of JJ development , population growth , and fossil fuel use . The results of each scenario in the IPCC ’s Fourth Assessment Report ( 2007 ) are depicted in the graph . The AR5 scenario with the smallest increases in NN gases is RCP 2.6 , which denotes the net radiative forcing by 2100 in watts per square metre ( a doubling of CO concentrations from preindustrial values of 280 ppm to 560 ppm represents roughly 3.7 watts per square metre ) . RCP 2.6 assumes substantial improvements in NN efficiency , a rapid transition away from fossil fuel NN , and a JJ population that peaks at roughly nine CD NNS in the 21st century . In that scenario CO concentrations remain below 450 ppm and actually fall toward the end of the century ( to about 420 ppm ) as a result of widespread deployment of NN - capture technology . Scenario RCP 8.5 , by contrast , might be described as “ business as usual . ” It reflects the assumption of an NN - intensive JJ economy , high population growth , and a reduced rate of technological development . CO concentrations are more than three times greater than preindustrial levels ( roughly 936 ppm ) by 2100 and continue to grow thereafter . RCP 4.5 and RCP 6.0 envision intermediate policy choices , resulting in stabilization by 2100 of CO concentrations at 538 and 670 ppm , respectively . In all those scenarios , the cooling effect of industrial pollutants such as sulfate particulates , which have masked some of the past century ’s NN , is assumed to decline to near zero by 2100 because of policies restricting their industrial production . The differences between the various simulations arise from disparities between the various NN models VBN and from assumptions made by each emission scenario . For example , best estimates of the predicted increases in JJ NN NN between the NNS 2000 and 2100 range from about 0.3 to 4.8 °C ( 0.5 to 8.6 °F ) , depending on which emission scenario is assumed and which NN model is VBN . Relative to preindustrial ( i.e. , 1750 – 1800 ) NNS , these estimates reflect an overall NN of the globe of 1.4 to 5.0 °C ( 2.5 to 9.0 °F ) . These projections are conservative in that they do not take into account potential positive NN cycle feedbacks ( VB above Feedback mechanisms and NN sensitivity ) . Only the lower - end NNS scenario RCP 2.6 has a reasonable chance ( roughly 50 percent ) of holding additional JJ NN NN by 2100 to less than 2.0 °C ( 3.6 °F ) — a level considered by JJ NNS to be the threshold above which pervasive and extreme climatic effects will occur . The greatest increase in near - NN air NN is projected to occur over the polar region of the Northern Hemisphere because of the melting of NN NN and the associated reduction in NN albedo . Greater NN is predicted over land areas than over the ocean . Largely due to the delayed NN of the oceans and their greater specific heat , the Northern Hemisphere — with less than 40 percent of its NN area covered by NN — is expected to warm faster than the Southern Hemisphere . Some of the regional variation in predicted NN is expected to arise from NNS to wind patterns and ocean currents in response to NN NN . For example , the NN of the region of the North Atlantic Ocean just south of Greenland is expected to be slight . This anomaly is projected to arise from a weakening of warm northward ocean currents combined with a shift in the jet stream that will bring colder polar air masses to the region . projected NNS in mean NN NNS Projected NNS in mean NN NNS by the late 21st century according to the A1B NN NN scenario . All values for the period 2090 – 99 are shown relative to the mean NN values for the period 1980 –99 . Learn how the Netherlands have combatted rising NN levels and flooding disasters with the Delta project VB all videos for this article The NN NNS associated with JJ NN are RB projected to lead to NNS in precipitation patterns across the globe . Increased precipitation is predicted in the polar and subpolar regions , whereas decreased precipitation is projected for the middle latitudes of both hemispheres as a result of the expected poleward shift in the jet streams . Whereas precipitation near the Equator is predicted to increase , it is thought that rainfall in the subtropics will decrease . Both phenomena are associated with a forecasted strengthening of the tropical Hadley cell pattern of atmospheric circulation . projected NNS in mean precipitation Projected NNS in mean precipitation by the late 21st century according to the A1B NN NN scenario . All values for the period 2090 – 99 are shown as a percentage relative to the mean precipitation values for the period 1980 – 99 . NNS in precipitation patterns are expected to increase the chances of both drought and flood conditions in JJ areas . Decreased summer precipitation in North NNP , Europe , and Africa , combined with greater rates of evaporation due to NN NN NNS , is projected to lead to decreased soil moisture and drought in JJ regions . Furthermore , since anthropogenic NN NN will likely lead to a more vigorous hydrologic cycle with greater rates of both evaporation and precipitation , there will be a greater probability for intense precipitation and flooding in JJ regions . Regional predictions of future NN NN remain limited by uncertainties in how the precise patterns of atmospheric winds and ocean currents will vary with increased NN NN . For example , some uncertainty remains in how the frequency and magnitude of El Niño / Southern Oscillation ( ENSO ) events will adjust to NN NN . Since ENSO is CD of the most prominent sources of interannual variations in regional patterns of precipitation and NN , any uncertainty in how it will VB implies a corresponding uncertainty in certain regional patterns of NN NN . For example , increased El Niño activity MD likely lead to more winter precipitation in some regions , such as the desert southwest of the NNP NNPS . This might offset the drought predicted for those regions , but at the same NN it might lead to less precipitation in other regions . Rising winter precipitation in the desert southwest of the NNP NNPS might exacerbate drought conditions in locations as far away as South Africa .

CD , 2020 , in Annapolis , Md. ( AP Photo / Brian Witte ) ANNAPOLIS , Md. ( AP ) — Maryland MD reduce NN gas NNS by 60 % by 2030 , under an ambitious measure outlined Wednesday as the coastal NN grapples with increasing concerns about NN - level rise . The legislation sponsored by Sen. Paul Pinsky and Del. Dana Stein MD increase the NN ’s current goal of cutting NN gas NNS by 40 % , VBN on 2006 levels . The measure RB MD set the NN on a path toward achieving net - zero statewide NN gas NNS by 2045 . Supporters of the “ NNP Solutions Act of 2020 ” VBP Maryland , which has about 3,100 NNS ( 5,000 kilometers ) of tidal shorelinemust be a leader in addressing rising NN levels that threaten the NN . “ We have to lead by example , ” Pinsky , a Prince George ’s County Democrat , VBD . “ We have to show the rest of the NN and the country we ’re doing something about it . ” Environmentalists VBP the measure is the the most comprehensive approach to addressing NN gas NNS before lawmakers this session in a legislature controlled by Democrats . Themeasure ’s goals includeplanting 1 CD trees a NN in the NN for a decade . It RB calls for requiring JJ commercial buildings with 25,000 square NNS of rooftop to use solar panels . The measure has powerful supporters in the General Assembly , including Senate NNP NNP NNP , though Pinsky conceded there MD be some NNS due to cost , and the goal for tree plantings “ MD be trimmed down . ” “ There are VBG to be some amendments , ” Pinsky VBD . “ There are VBG to be some costs we ’ll have to bring down . ” The NN ’s vehicle and bus fleet MD become electric vehicles by 2030 , under the measure , and a NN program MD be expanded to increase NN efficiency . The measure RB MD create a work group focused on identifying communities affected most by NN NN . “ There ’s a lot more that our NN MD be doing to benefit the communities that are hardest hit , ” VBD Sen . Mary NNP , a Democrat from Baltimore , where flooding and heatwaves are rising concerns . Now , she VBZ she ’s increasingly seeing NNS younger than her at rallies and events seeking NN . “ I ’m here because I VBP this NN will put us on a path to having a livable future , ” Benson VBD . Pinsky has criticized a draft plan released by Gov. Larry Hogan ’s administration , saying it contains vague steps to reach the previously set goal of a 40 % reduction in NN gas . He contends the administration is not VBG far enough . “ They ’ve relied on low - hanging fruit , easy things , ” Pinsky , who chairs a committee that handles JJ legislation , VBD . “ They have not been willing to take on the tough battles , and that ’s what we ’re doing here today with the NNP Solutions Act of 2020 . ” But Ben Grumbles , the secretary of the Maryland Department of the Environment , VBD the Republican governor supports getting the NN to VBG 100 % clean electricity by 2040 . “ There ’s far more common ground then what PRP is led to VB , ” Grumbles VBD . “ On the low - hanging fruit argument , we are focused on harvesting all the fruit wherever it is : low - hanging , high - hanging , as well as planting additional seeds for additional fruits in the coming NNS . ” Grumbles described the draft plan as “ bold and balanced , ” reaching an estimated 44 % reduction goal by 2030 . “ We are very open to working with legislators to continue to look for real and achievable and ambitious strategies , ” Grumbles VBD .

text: Impact investing is an extension of socially responsible investing , which focuses on NNS that promote ethical and socially responsible consciousness such as JJ sustainability , JJ justice , and corporate ethics . Impact investing goes a step further by actively seeking investments that can create a significant , positive impact .﻿﻿ Impact investing focuses on investing in NNS or organizations to create a measurable societal benefit while still generating a favorable financial return . Impact investing is typically centered IN addressing a JJ issue , such as poverty or education , or an JJ issue , such as clean NN . As of publication , the top five impact investing firms on the basis of assets under management are Vital Capital Fund , Triodos Investment Management , The Reinvestment Fund , BlueOrchard Finance S.A. , and Community Reinvestment Fund , USA . Vital Capital Fund is a private equity fund with approximately $ 350 CD in assets . The fund invests in developing areas , principally sub-Saharan Africa , in businesses and projects designed to enhance quality of NN , and RB offer substantial investment returns﻿﻿.﻿﻿ The primary investment focus of the Vital Capital Fund is on the development of infrastructure , housing projects , agro - industrial projects , renewable NN , NN care , and education . Among the fund 's investments are the Luanda NNP Center in Angola and WaterHealth International .﻿﻿ Triodos Investment Management is a subsidiary of Triodos Bank , headquartered in the Netherlands , which manages over a dozen sustainable investment funds . Triodos has been actively engaged in impact investing since 1995 and as of publication has approximately $ 5 CD in assets .﻿﻿﻿﻿ Primary areas of interest include renewable NN , sustainable food and agriculture ( including organic farming ) , NN care , and education .﻿﻿ Triodos is CD of the founding members of the NNP Impact Investing Network .﻿﻿ Its investments are spread throughout Europe , South NNP , Africa , India , and Southeast Asia . The Reinvestment Fund , headquartered in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania , is a non-profit community development financial institution . With an estimated $ 1.2 CD in assets under management as of publication , the fund finances housing projects , access to NN care , educational programs , and job initiatives . It operates primarily by assisting distressed towns and communities in the NNP NNPS . It RB provides U.S. cities with JJ policy advice and NN analysis services to assist in developing community programs .﻿﻿ BlueOrchard Finance , with principal offices in Switzerland , operates in more than 80 emerging and frontier markets IN the NN , including areas in Asia , Latin NNP , Africa , and Eastern Europe . Created as part of a NNP Nations initiative in 2001 , BlueOrchard Finance was established as the JJ commercial manager of microfinance debt investment worldwide . As of publication , BlueOrchard has invested in more than 200 CD entrepreneurs across the globe . It provides both debt and equity financing to businesses and institutions , with an emphasis on alleviating hunger and poverty , fostering entrepreneurship , establishing food production and education programs , and working on NN NN issues .﻿﻿ BlueOrchard Finance has approximately $ 3.5 CD in assets under management .﻿﻿ Community Reinvestment Fund , USA was founded in 1988 , in Minneapolis , Minnesota , as a national non-profit certified community development financial institution . Its mission is to empower NNS to improve their lives and their communities . The Community Reinvestment Fund partners with local private lenders to provide financing capital for community development projects . These include JJ business loans for the purpose of growing a business , expanding staff or increasing NN efficiency .﻿﻿ But with more than $ 250 CD in assets , along with access to additional JJ - term loan capital through the Community Development Financial Institution Bond Guarantee Program , the Community Reinvestment Fund RB provides funding assistance for community housing projects , NN care centers , charter schools , daycare centers , and JJ businesses .
